analyzed: smras pa / kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du /
translated: He said, “O son of the victors, in the same way,

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, in this way, the Bodhisattvas, the Great Beings,🔽should understand the complete nirvana of the Tathagatas.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba /

original: chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa /

original: chos kyi dbyings ltar mtha' dang dbus med pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ltar mtha' dang dbus med pa /
translated: It is without center or edge, like the realm of reality.🔽It is the reality of the realm of space.🔽It is the nonarising and nonceasing of suchness.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin can de bzhin nyid kyis mi skye mi 'gag pa yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa dus bzhin du rab tu ston pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin can de bzhin nyid kyis mi skye mi 'gag pa yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa dus bzhin du rab tu ston pa /
translated: It is the abiding in the limit of reality.🔽It is the teaching of the four times.

analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par sngon gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: It is the blessing of the past.

analyzed: 'gro ba'i zhing thams cad dang / chos kyi dbyings rab 'byam thams cad las mi 'da' bar khong du chud par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the understanding of the nontransgression of the realm of beings, of all buddhafields, and of the entire realm of reality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /

original: rab 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni 'di lta ste /

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs so / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: It is emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Sacred Teachings:

original: 'od srungs chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Kāśyapa, the realization of the equality of all phenomena is nirvana.

original: yang de nyid las rigs kyi bu gang yang de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa de /
analyzed: yang de nyid las rigs kyi bu gang yang de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad pa de /
translated: And in the same text: Son of noble family, whatever the Tathāgata does,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad cing yun ring po de srid nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mdzad cing yun ring po de srid nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: the Tathāgata does it for a long time, since he fully awakened to buddhahood.

original: tshe'i tshad dpag tu med par de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu bzhugs shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad dpag tu med par de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu bzhugs shing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata always remains and does not pass into parinirvāṇa for an immeasurable life span.

original: 'dul ba'i dbang gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston to //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i dbang gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston to //
translated: He demonstrates passing into parinirvāṇa through his power to guide.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngas rnam grangs des sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ngas rnam grangs des sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: I do this through various means in order to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: snying rje chen po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Sūtra of Great Compassion:

original: tshangs pa 'di ltar 'jig rten 'di las zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa dang / sdug bsngal zad pa dang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bas zhi zhing byang ste /

translated: Brahma, in this way, the world is calmed, purified, and completely extinguished by the exhaustion of karma, by the exhaustion of afflictions, by the exhaustion of suffering, and by the pacification of suffering.

original: rnam par zhi pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par zhi pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The complete extinction of suffering is called nirvana.

original: tshangs pa de la las gang yin pa de zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dang bral zhing nub pa ma gtogs par mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yang med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa de la las gang yin pa de zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dang bral zhing nub pa ma gtogs par mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yang med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Brahma, in that regard, there is no nirvana whatsoever apart from the exhaustion of karma and the separation from and disappearance of afflictions.

original: 'jig rten las 'das @187b pa'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das @187b pa'i le'u las kyang /
translated: The Transcendent Chapter also says:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa kun du bstan pa la 'jug pa ni mtha' yas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa kun du bstan pa la 'jug pa ni mtha' yas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The teaching of the nirvana of the buddhas is infinite.”

original: 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa tshangs pas zhus pa las kyang /
translated: The Questions of Brahma also says:

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Bhagavan, what is called ‘nirvana’

original: gang mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang mtshan ma thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / g-yo ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the pacification of all signs and the freedom from all movement.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is said:

original: tshangs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽phan tshun du rkyen gyis sgro btags pa med pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni / phan tshun du rkyen gyis sgro btags pa med pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Brahmā, “nirvāṇa” means🔽the absence of mutual conditions.

original: yang dag par ldan pa'i lung las kyang /
analyzed: yang dag par ldan pa'i lung las kyang /
translated: And in the Connected Discourses it is said:

original: dge slong dag khyed la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro ba'i lam bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro ba'i lam bshad par bya'o //
translated: “Monks, I will teach you nirvāṇa and the path that leads to nirvāṇa.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is nirvāṇa?🔽It is the exhaustion of desire,

original: 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa'o //
translated: the exhaustion of hatred, and the exhaustion of delusion.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path that leads to nirvāṇa?

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di nyid do zhes gsungs so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Sūtra of the Extensive Secrets of the Transcendent Lord🔽it is said:

analyzed: mood gal gyi bu sngon byung ba /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana, in the past

original: de bzhin gshegs pa snyan pa brjod pa zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa snyan pa brjod pa zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: there was a thus-gone one called Sweet Voice.

original: de'i nyan thos 'dus pa yang byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i nyan thos 'dus pa yang byung ngo //

analyzed: de'i tshe na sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na dge slong dmigs pa kun la mtshungs par lta ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa gcig cig yod de / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dpag tu med pa rnams la /
translated: At that time, in that buddha realm, there was a monk called Equal View of All Objects, who had entered the Great Vehicle.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed kyang /
translated: He had planted roots of virtue with countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of buddhas,

analyzed: de de srid kyi bar du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems la ma zhugs kyi /

original: theg pa chen po bla na med pa la yang dag par zhugs te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bla na med pa la yang dag par zhugs te /
translated: He had entered the unsurpassed Great Vehicle

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yongs su sbyong bar 'dod do //
translated: and wished to purify inexpressibly inexpressible buddha realms.

analyzed: yang de'i tshe na sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na dge slong gcig po de ma gtogs par sems can gzhan gang gis kyang /
translated: At that time, in that buddha realm, except for that single monk, no other sentient being

original: byang chub kyi phyir byang chub tu sems ma bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir byang chub tu sems ma bskyed de /
translated: had given rise to the mind of awakening for the sake of awakening.

original: de chos zab mo thams cad la dbang zos pas /
analyzed: de chos zab mo thams cad la dbang zos pas /
translated: Since he had mastered all the profound teachings,

original: lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du skyes so //🔽de nas de bzhin gshegs pa snyan pa brjod pas /
analyzed: lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du skyes so // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa snyan pa brjod pas /
translated: he was reborn among the long-lived gods.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad nas /🔽sems can chen po gang la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad @188a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad nas / sems can chen po gang la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad @188a * //
translated: Then the Thus-Gone One, having accomplished the deeds of a buddha by speaking pleasantly,🔽saw that there was no other great being in all the buddha realms🔽to whom he could entrust the deeds of a buddha.

original: pa ma mdzad ces sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gzigs pa dang / des theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can gcig po de la byang chub kyi snod du gyur na /
analyzed: pa ma mdzad ces sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gzigs pa dang / des theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can gcig po de la byang chub kyi snod du gyur na /
translated: He saw that the single being who had entered the Great Vehicle was a suitable vessel for awakening,

original: de yang mi dal ba rnyed nas de lus de nyid kyis byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal pa med de /
analyzed: de yang mi dal ba rnyed nas de lus de nyid kyis byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal pa med de /
translated: but that being had not found a favorable opportunity to generate roots of virtue for awakening in that very body.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por lhung ste /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por lhung ste /
translated: Then, after dying and transmigrating, he fell into the great Avīci hell.

original: de de nas yang byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal ba med la /
analyzed: de de nas yang byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i skal ba med la /
translated: There, he was not even fit to generate roots of virtue for awakening.

original: de mnar med pa nas shi 'phos te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes kyang blun po lug ltar lkugs pa lag brda byed pa chos go ba'i mthu med par gzigs nas /
analyzed: de mnar med pa nas shi 'phos te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes kyang blun po lug ltar lkugs pa lag brda byed pa chos go ba'i mthu med par gzigs nas /
translated: After dying and transmigrating from Avīci, he was reborn among humans, but he was a fool, mute like a sheep, and unable to communicate by gestures.

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa de sprul te /
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa de sprul te /
translated: The Tathāgata emanated himself there

original: sems can de yongs su smin par mdzad do //
analyzed: sems can de yongs su smin par mdzad do //

original: sprul pas de yongs su smin par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: sprul pas de yongs su smin par mdzad pa na /

analyzed: skye ba bye ba khrag khrig phrag drug cur de bzhin gshegs pa de mi bde ba myong ngo //

original: mood gal gyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po la ltos /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po la ltos /
translated: Maudgalyāyana, behold the great compassion of the Tathāgata!

original: sems can gcig gi phyir yang bskal pa grangs med par mi bde ba myong zhing gang zag da yongs su smin par mdzad nas phyir mi ldog pa'i lam la gzhag go //
analyzed: sems can gcig gi phyir yang bskal pa grangs med par mi bde ba myong zhing gang zag da yongs su smin par mdzad nas phyir mi ldog pa'i lam la gzhag go //
translated: For the sake of a single being, he would experience discomfort for countless eons, and having brought that person to maturity, he would establish him on the irreversible path.

original: mood gal gyi bu de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Maudgalyāyana, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa snyan pa brjod pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam na de ltar mi lta'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa snyan pa brjod pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam na de ltar mi lta'o //
translated: If you think that the Tathāgata who at that time, in those days, was called ‘Sweet Voice’ was someone else, you should not see it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa don thams cad gzigs pa de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa don thams cad gzigs pa de /
translated: The Tathāgata Sarvārthasiddha

original: de'i tshe snyan pa brjod par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe snyan pa brjod par gyur to //
translated: at that time, in those days, was Sweet Voice.

original: mood gal gyi bu de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: mood gal gyi bu de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Maudgalyāyana, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe dge slong dmigs pa kun la mtshungs par lta ba zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam na yang de ltar mi lta'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong dmigs pa kun la mtshungs par lta ba zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam na yang de ltar mi lta'o //
translated: If you think that the monk who at that time, in those days, was called ‘Equal View of All Objects’ was someone else, you should not see it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med de'i tshe /
translated: The Tathāgata Amitābha

original: dge slong dmigs pa kun la mtshungs par lta ba zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dmigs pa kun la mtshungs par lta ba zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs so //
translated: He became the monk called “Equal View in All Objects.”

original: yang yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: yang yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Also, the Meeting of Father and Son Sūtra says:

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus bskal pa dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus bskal pa dpag tu med pa /
translated: Monks, in the past, immeasurable,

original: bgrang du med pa /
analyzed: bgrang du med pa /
translated: incalculable,

original: bsam gyi mi khyab pa /🔽mtshungs pa med pa /
analyzed: bsam gyi mi khyab pa / mtshungs pa med pa /
translated: inconceivable,🔽unequalled,

original: gzhal du med pa brjod du med pa /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa brjod du med pa /
translated: inexpressible,

original: 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: in the eons of the past,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @188b dbang po'i tog ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @188b dbang po'i tog ces bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste /
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, Indradhvaja, appeared in the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po'i tog gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po'i tog gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las /
translated: The buddhafield of the Tathāgata Indradhvaja was equal to the world systems of the sands of the Ganges River.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu gyur to //
translated: It became a single buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyang bde ba lnga thob par gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyang bde ba lnga thob par gyur te /
translated: The sentient beings who lived in that buddhafield obtained the five kinds of bliss.

analyzed: 'di ltar la la ni 'dod pa'i bde ba dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Some of them were endowed with the happiness of the desire realm.

analyzed: la la ni khyim nas 'byung ba'i bde ba dang ldan par gyur to // la la ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba dang ldan par gyur to //

analyzed: la la ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba dang ldan par gyur to //

analyzed: la la ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: Some of them were endowed with the happiness of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de dag bde ba de la yang spyod la /
analyzed: de dag bde ba de la yang spyod la /
translated: They enjoyed those pleasures,

original: de dag de la yang mngon par zhen pa med par gyur to //
analyzed: de dag de la yang mngon par zhen pa med par gyur to //
translated: but they did not settle down on them.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /

analyzed: bung ba me tog gi khu bas nye bar 'tsho yang de la mngon par zhen pa med do //

original: de bzhin du sems can de dag kyang bde ba de la yongs su spyod kyang di la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can de dag kyang bde ba de la yongs su spyod kyang di la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: In the same way, those beings enjoyed those pleasures but did not settle down on them.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It was like this:

original: bar snang la rgyu ba'i bya ni bar snang la rgyu yang de la mngon par chags pa yang med do //
analyzed: bar snang la rgyu ba'i bya ni bar snang la rgyu yang de la mngon par chags pa yang med do //
translated: Birds flying in the sky do not cling to the sky.

original: de bzhin du sems can de dag kyang bde ba de la yongs su spyod kyang de la mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can de dag kyang bde ba de la yongs su spyod kyang de la mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: In the same way, those sentient beings enjoy that happiness, but they do not cling to it.

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po'i tog ces bgyi bar gyur pa de ni /🔽bcom ldan 'das nyid de'i tshe dus na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po'i tog ces bgyi bar gyur pa de ni / bcom ldan 'das nyid de'i tshe dus na /
translated: At that time, the Tathāgata Indrarāja was none other than🔽the Blessed One himself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po'i tog ces bgyi bar gyur par 'tshal to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po'i tog ces bgyi bar gyur par 'tshal to zhes gsungs so //
translated: At that time, he was the Tathāgata Indrarāja.

original: lang dkar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: lang dkar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Sūtra on Going to Laṅkā,🔽I do not attain nirvana as an entity,

original: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //🔽rnam rtog rnam par shes pa las //🔽bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
analyzed: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' // rnam rtog rnam par shes pa las // bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
translated: as an action, or as a characteristic.🔽I attain nirvana by turning away

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: from conceptual consciousness.

original: theg pa gcig la mos pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: theg pa gcig la mos pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: And sentient beings who aspire to the One Vehicle are extremely rare.

original: theg pa gcig tu zad par ni mdo sde du ma las gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: theg pa gcig tu zad par ni mdo sde du ma las gsungs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The sūtras state that there is only one vehicle.

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las 'byung ba /
translated: The noble Lotus Sūtra says:

original: nga yang theg pa gcig las brtsams te sems can rnams la chos 'chad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nga yang theg pa gcig las brtsams te sems can rnams la chos 'chad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: I teach the Dharma to sentient beings by relying on the one vehicle,

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa ste /🔽theg pa gnyis @189a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa ste / theg pa gnyis @189a * //
translated: which is the vehicle of the buddhas, the culmination of omniscience.

original: sam gsum zhes bya ba dag kyang med do //
analyzed: sam gsum zhes bya ba dag kyang med do //
translated: There are not two or three vehicles.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten thams cad na yang chos nyid ni 'di'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gang 'das pa'i dus na byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyang theg pa chen po gcig las brtsams nas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten thams cad na yang chos nyid ni 'di'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gang 'das pa'i dus na byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyang theg pa chen po gcig las brtsams nas /
translated: The nature of reality is the same in all worlds in the ten directions.

original: sems can rnams la chos bstan te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos bstan te /
translated: Why is this? In all the worlds of the ten directions, all the tathāgatas of the past taught the Dharma to sentient beings by relying on the one great vehicle.

original: gang 'di sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
translated: This is the vehicle of the buddhas.

original: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang /
translated: Those tathāgatas who will appear in the future

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig pu la brtsams nas sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig pu la brtsams nas sems can rnams la chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: will teach the Dharma to sentient beings, beginning with the single vehicle of the buddhas.

original: gang da ltar byung ba'i dus na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi thog pa gcig pu la brtsams nas /
analyzed: gang da ltar byung ba'i dus na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi thog pa gcig pu la brtsams nas /
translated: Those tathāgatas in all the world systems of the ten directions who are present now

original: sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: also teach the Dharma to sentient beings, beginning with the single vehicle of the buddhas.

original: de rnams grangs 'dis de ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams grangs 'dis de ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: They should understand it in this way by means of this enumeration.

original: phyogs cu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na yang theg pa gnyis su btags pa yang med na /
analyzed: phyogs cu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na yang theg pa gnyis su btags pa yang med na /
translated: In no world system of the ten directions is there even a designation of a second vehicle,

original: gsum du lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum du lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
translated: let alone a third.

original: 'phags pa bden pa'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa bden pa'i le'u las kyang /
translated: The noble chapter on truth also says,

original: 'jam dpal theg pa gcig gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jam dpal theg pa gcig gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, because there is only one vehicle for definite release,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni theg pa chen po'i snying po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de ni theg pa chen po'i snying po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: that buddha-field has the essence of the Great Vehicle.

original: nga la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rnam par dgod pa med do //
analyzed: nga la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rnam par dgod pa med do //
translated: I do not teach the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'du shes sna tshogs med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'du shes sna tshogs med pa'i phyir te /
translated: And why? Because the Tathāgata has no various thoughts.

original: 'jam dpal gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la la dag ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la la dag ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, if the Tathāgata were to teach the Mahāyāna to some,

original: la la dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ;
analyzed: la la dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ;
translated: the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas to others,

original: la la dag ni nyan thos kyi theg pa bshad par gyur na de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems yongs su ma dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la la dag ni nyan thos kyi theg pa bshad par gyur na de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems yongs su ma dag par 'gyur te /
translated: and the vehicle of the śrāvakas to still others, then the Tathāgata’s mind would not be pure.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur /
translated: It would be a fault of clinging.

original: snying rje chen po nyi tshe bar yang 'gyur /
analyzed: snying rje chen po nyi tshe bar yang 'gyur /
translated: It would be a fault of limited compassion.

original: 'du shes tha dad pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du shes tha dad pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur /
translated: It would be a fault of various thoughts.

original: nga chos la slob dpon dpe mkhyud byas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga chos la slob dpon dpe mkhyud byas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: I would be a teacher who is stingy with the Dharma.

original: 'jam dpal ngas sems can rnams la chos gang dang gang bstan pa de dag thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ngas sems can rnams la chos gang dang gang bstan pa de dag thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, whatever Dharma I teach to sentient beings, all of it is like this:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub la gzhol ba /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub la gzhol ba /
translated: They are dedicated to enlightenment in order to attain omniscient wisdom.

original: theg pa chen po la 'bab pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'bab pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa /
translated: They accomplish omniscience, which is based on the Great Vehicle.

original: yul @189b gcig tu yang dag par phyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yul @189b gcig tu yang dag par phyin par byed pa ste /
translated: They are dedicated to the single domain.

original: de bas na nga la theg pa rnam par dgod pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na nga la theg pa rnam par dgod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, I do not posit any vehicles.

original: 'jam dpal theg pa rnam par dgod pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal theg pa rnam par dgod pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the so-called positing of vehicles

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sa rnam par dgod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sa rnam par dgod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: is the positing of the stages by the Tathāgata.

original: de ni gang zag rnam par dgod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gang zag rnam par dgod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is the positing of individuals.

original: tshogs chung ngu dang / tshogs tshad med pa rnam par dgod par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs chung ngu dang / tshogs tshad med pa rnam par dgod par mdzad pa ste /
translated: It is the positing of those with little accumulation and those with immeasurable accumulation.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'di la theg pa tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tha dad pa med pa'i phyir 'di la theg pa tha dad pa med de /
translated: There are no different vehicles here because the realm of phenomena is undifferentiated.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob tu 'jug pa bstan pa /
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob tu 'jug pa bstan pa /
translated: This is the teaching on the conventional engagement.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo tsam du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo tsam du brjod pa'o //
translated: It is merely an entrance gate.

original: gang don dam par theg pa gcig pa ni gnyis pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang don dam par theg pa gcig pa ni gnyis pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is the single vehicle ultimately is not a second.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: lha'i bu gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag gis /
analyzed: lha'i bu gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag gis /
translated: “Divine sons, those who have generated the mind of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: should generate the mind of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: gang dag yang dag pa nyid du nges par zhugs pa de dag ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: gang dag yang dag pa nyid du nges par zhugs pa de dag ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do //
translated: Those who have entered into reality do not have the power to generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have cut the continuum of cyclic existence.

original: de dag gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na ni /
analyzed: de dag gal te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na ni /
translated: If they were to generate the mind of unsurpassed, complete enlightenment,

original: nga yang rjes su yi rang zhing /
analyzed: nga yang rjes su yi rang zhing /
translated: I would rejoice.

original: nga de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la bar chad mi byed de /
analyzed: nga de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba la bar chad mi byed de /
translated: I would not create obstacles to their roots of virtue.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa bas kyang shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams la lhag par dmigs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa bas kyang shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams la lhag par dmigs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: They should focus on the qualities that are even more exalted than the exalted.”

original: 'dus pa chen po'i le'u las kyang /🔽theg pa gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus pa chen po'i le'u las kyang / theg pa gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba ni /
translated: The Chapter on the Great Assembly also says:🔽The perfect inclusion in one vehicle is

original: theg pa thams cad theg pa gcig tu mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du ste /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad theg pa gcig tu mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du ste /
translated: the perfect inclusion of all vehicles in the equality of one vehicle.

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa la 'jug par tshul gcig go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa la 'jug par tshul gcig go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The single method is to enter the indivisible expanse of reality.

original: 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa gzungs kyi dbang phyug rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra Requested by the Noble Lord of Gnosis King also says:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gtam sna tshogs kyi chen du 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni gtam sna tshogs kyi chen du 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The Lord Buddhas do not arise from various discourses.

original: chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa sgrib pa med pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa sgrib pa med pa /
translated: The expanse of reality is of one taste, free from obscurations,

original: sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la go skabs 'byed pa /
translated: and opens the way for all sentient beings.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽sems can rnams khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / sems can rnams khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having fully awakened,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: in order to bring sentient beings to understanding,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //🔽rigs kyi bu 'di @190a * //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro // rigs kyi bu 'di @190a * //
translated: they turn the irreversible wheel.

original: lta ste dper na /
analyzed: lta ste dper na /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this:

original: nor bu mkhan gyis nor bu'i rigs las sbyang ba ma byas pa'i nor bu rin po che blangs nas /
analyzed: nor bu mkhan gyis nor bu'i rigs las sbyang ba ma byas pa'i nor bu rin po che blangs nas /
translated: A jeweler, having taken a precious gem from its ore,

original: bul tog gi chu rnon pos bkrus te /
analyzed: bul tog gi chu rnon pos bkrus te /
translated: washes it with a strong alkaline solution,🔽and polishes it with a black goat hair cloth.

original: skra nag po'i la bas byi dor byas kyang de tsam gyis brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod kyi /
analyzed: skra nag po'i la bas byi dor byas kyang de tsam gyis brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod kyi /
translated: But he does not stop his efforts at that point.

original: de'i 'og tu de rdul chu rnon po dang bcas pas bkrus te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de rdul chu rnon po dang bcas pas bkrus te /
translated: After that, he washes it with a strong alkaline solution and water,

original: shing dang snam bus byi dor bya bas byi dor byed do //
analyzed: shing dang snam bus byi dor bya bas byi dor byed do //
translated: and polishes it with wood and cotton cloth.

original: de tsam gyis kyang brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: But he does not stop his efforts at that point.

original: de'i 'og tu yang sman chen po'i khu bas bkrus te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang sman chen po'i khu bas bkrus te /
translated: After that, he washes it with a solution of great herbs,

original: ras phra mos byi dor byas pas byi dor byed do //
analyzed: ras phra mos byi dor byas pas byi dor byed do //
translated: and polishes it with fine cotton cloth.

original: byi dor byas te nor bu mchid bu'i rigs dang bral nas beed'urya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byi dor byas te nor bu mchid bu'i rigs dang bral nas beed'urya zhes bya'o //
translated: When the polishing is finished, the gem is free from all impurities and is called a beryl.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su ma dag pa'i sems can gyi khams rig nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gtam gyis 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams yid 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su ma dag pa'i sems can gyi khams rig nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gtam gyis 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams yid 'byung bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, the Tathagata, knowing the realm of sentient beings to be impure, causes those sentient beings who delight in cyclic existence to become disenchanted with it through discourses on impermanence, suffering, no-self, and repulsiveness that engender disenchantment.

original: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'jug par byed do //
translated: He causes them to enter the noble Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod kyi /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod kyi /
translated: But the Tathagata does not stop his effort there.

original: de'i 'og tu stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i gtam gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtam gyi tshul khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i gtam gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtam gyi tshul khong du chud par byed do //
translated: After that, he causes them to understand the Tathagata's way of teaching through discourses on emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de tsam gyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod kyi /
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa brtson 'grus rgyun mi gcod kyi /
translated: But the Tathagata does not stop his effort there.

original: de'i 'og tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i gtam dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i gtam gyis /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i gtam dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i gtam gyis /
translated: After that, he causes them to enter the irreversible wheel and the discourse on the complete purity of the three sectors.

original: sems can de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'dzud do //
analyzed: sems can de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'dzud do //
translated: They introduce those sentient beings to the domain of the Tathāgata.

original: sems can rgyud dang rang bzhin sna tshogs pa de dag mnyam du zhugs nas /
analyzed: sems can rgyud dang rang bzhin sna tshogs pa de dag mnyam du zhugs nas /
translated: Those sentient beings, with their various dispositions and natures, enter into sameness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid khong du chud pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid khong du chud pas /
translated: Having understood the reality of the Tathāgata,

original: sbyin gnas bla na med pa rnams zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyin gnas bla na med pa rnams zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: they are called the unsurpassed recipients of offerings.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra of the Irreversible Wheel also says:

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gsol pa ;
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gsol pa ;
translated: The youthful Mañjuśrī said:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ji tsam zhig mthun /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ji tsam zhig mthun /
translated: “How many teachings do the Buddha-Bhagavāns teach?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi 'khor lor mthun no //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar bcom ldan @190b 'das de theg pa gsum la brtsams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos bstan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi 'khor lor mthun no // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar bcom ldan @190b 'das de theg pa gsum la brtsams te /
translated: “The teachings of the Buddha-Bhagavāns are in accord with the irreversible wheel of Dharma.”

original: de ltar chos ston /
analyzed: de ltar chos ston /
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Bhagavān, how do the Bhagavāns teach the Dharma, beginning with the three vehicles?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: rigs kyi bu sems can de dag ni dman pa la mos pa dag ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can de dag ni dman pa la mos pa dag ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, those sentient beings have inferior aspirations.

original: de dag theg pa gcig la mi 'jug pas na /
analyzed: de dag theg pa gcig la mi 'jug pas na /
translated: Since they do not enter the One Vehicle,

original: thabs mkhas pas de dag de ltar nye bar khrid de rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thabs mkhas pa chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas de dag de ltar nye bar khrid de rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thabs mkhas pa chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the skillful means of the Buddhas leads them in that way.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni snyigs ma lnga'i dus na byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni snyigs ma lnga'i dus na byung ste /
translated: The Bhagavat appeared in the time of the five degenerations.

original: de dag ni theg pa gcig la ma mos pa dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag ni theg pa gcig la ma mos pa dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are not devoted to the One Vehicle.

original: 'phags pa dpal gyi phreng ba seng ge'i sgra'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dpal gyi phreng ba seng ge'i sgra'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Lion’s Roar of Queen Śrīmālā Sūtra also says,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The term ‘nirvāṇa’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thabs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thabs so //
translated: is a skillful means of the Tathāgatas.

original: theg pa gsum po thams cad kyang theg pa gcig po'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po thams cad kyang theg pa gcig po'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: All the three vehicles are counted as one vehicle,

original: theg pa gcig khong du chud pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub khong du chud do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: theg pa gcig khong du chud pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub khong du chud do zhes gsungs so //
translated: because by understanding the one vehicle, one understands unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.”

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The noble Descent into Laṅkā Sūtra also says,🔽“The three vehicles are taught in order to convert the three kinds of aspirants.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams bag chags kyi nyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis myos pa med par gyur nas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams bag chags kyi nyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis myos pa med par gyur nas /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, having become free from the fault of latent tendencies and the intoxication of samādhi,

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas slar sad de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas slar sad de /
translated: awaken from the uncontaminated realm.

original: yang 'jig rten gyi dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings su gtogs pa'i tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par bkang nas /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings su gtogs pa'i tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par bkang nas /
translated: Then, having filled the uncontaminated realm of the world and beyond with the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: chos kyi sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa la dbang med par rab tu thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa la dbang med par rab tu thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: they attain the inconceivable dharmakāya without effort.

original: de lta mod kyi sems can gyi dge ba'i tshogs spyod pa tha dad pa dang / 'dul ba'i dbang dang theg pa sna tshogs kyi sgo ston pas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sems can gyi dge ba'i tshogs spyod pa tha dad pa dang / 'dul ba'i dbang dang theg pa sna tshogs kyi sgo ston pas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa la 'jug go //
translated: However, due to the different practices of the accumulations of merit and wisdom of sentient beings, and due to the power of those to be trained, the tathāgatas engage in teaching the Dharma in the different world systems through revealing the various vehicles.

original: theg pa gsum du yang ma zad de /
analyzed: theg pa gsum du yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only the three vehicles,

original: sdong po bkod pa'i rnam par thar pa las rnam par snang byed dpal gyi 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas ye shes rin chen 'od 'phro dpal yon tan gyi tog gi rgyal po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu sems can
analyzed: sdong po bkod pa'i rnam par thar pa las rnam par snang byed dpal gyi 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas ye shes rin chen 'od 'phro dpal yon tan gyi tog gi rgyal po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu sems can
translated: In the Liberation of the Array of Trunks, it says that as soon as the Tathagata All-knowing Jewel Radiance Glorious Peak of Qualities King fully awakened in the world system of Vairocana,

original: dpag tu med pa dag ni nyan thos kyi sa la bkod /🔽sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni rang byang chub la bkod /🔽sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni shugs dang @191a * //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa dag ni nyan thos kyi sa la bkod / sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni rang byang chub la bkod / sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni shugs dang @191a * //
translated: inconceivable sentient beings were established in the state of the Shravakas,🔽inconceivable sentient beings were established in the state of the Pratyekabuddhas,

original: ldan pa'i spobs pas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /🔽sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni pha rol gnon pa dri ma med pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: ldan pa'i spobs pas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod / sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni pha rol gnon pa dri ma med pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi byang chub la bkod /
translated: inconceivable sentient beings were established in the enlightenment of the power of eloquence,🔽inconceivable sentient beings were established in the enlightenment of stainless victory banner,

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni chos la spobs pas ngas par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni chos la spobs pas ngas par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
translated: inconceivable sentient beings were established in the enlightenment of eloquence in the Dharma,🔽and inconceivable sentient beings were established in the enlightenment of the power of the Dharma.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni dbang po yongs su dag pa'i spobs pas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni dbang po yongs su dag pa'i spobs pas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
translated: He established countless beings in the enlightenment of deliverance through the eloquence of the pure faculties.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni stobs mnyam pa nyid yang dag par spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro bas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la yongs su smin par byas /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni stobs mnyam pa nyid yang dag par spyod pa'i rjes su 'gro bas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la yongs su smin par byas /
translated: He ripened countless beings for the enlightenment of deliverance through following the practice of the equality of the powers.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni chos kyi grong khyer la mngon par phyogs pa'i yul gyi theg pa srid pa nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni chos kyi grong khyer la mngon par phyogs pa'i yul gyi theg pa srid pa nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
translated: He established countless beings in the enlightenment of deliverance through the vehicle of the domain that is directed toward the city of the Dharma and the transcendence of existence.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni thams cad du song ba'i rdzu 'phrul mi phyed pa'i tshul gyis theg pa nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni thams cad du song ba'i rdzu 'phrul mi phyed pa'i tshul gyis theg pa nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
translated: He established countless beings in the enlightenment of deliverance through the vehicle of the indivisible way of going everywhere with miraculous powers.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni spyod pa'i sbyor ba tshad med pa yang dag par 'du bas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni spyod pa'i sbyor ba tshad med pa yang dag par 'du bas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
translated: He established countless beings in the enlightenment of deliverance through the practice of the infinite application of conduct.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
translated: He established countless sentient beings in the enlightenment of definite emergence by means of abiding in samādhi.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni dmigs pa thams cad kyi yul yongs su dag pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni dmigs pa thams cad kyi yul yongs su dag pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub la bkod /
translated: He established countless sentient beings in the enlightenment of definite emergence by means of the maṇḍala of the pure domain of all objects.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub la sems bskyed /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i chos rtag tu yongs su gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: dad pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i mdo las 'byung ba 'jam @191b dpal de la dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung na /

analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bzung na sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi 'chad par byas pa yin no //

translated: If you wish to not interrupt the lineage of the buddhas, if you wish to destroy the afflictions of all sentient beings, if you wish to close the door to all bad rebirths, if you wish to experience the countless, immeasurable pleasures of a universal monarch, Śakra,

analyzed: tha na sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la yang yongs su bzung ba ji tsam chung ngu yang bya'o zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /

original: bzhi po de dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag go zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: yang mdo de nyid kyi sngon gyi tshul gyi le'u las kyang /
translated: The chapter on past events in the same sūtra says,

analyzed: rgyal bu dri ma med pa'i gzi brjid kyi sa /

translated: what need is there to mention someone who teaches even just one verse of four lines that is endowed with the perfections and is devoted to recitation and instruction?🔽I do not explain the limit of that person’s

analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad rnam par zhi par mthong ba de'i @194b tshe ; tshul bzhin mthong ngo //
translated: When he sees that all phenomena are completely pacified, then he sees correctly.

analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis snyoms par zhugs par mthong ba de'i tshe / tshul bzhin mthong ngo //
translated: When he sees that all phenomena are naturally in meditative equipoise, then he sees correctly.

analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad shin tu yang dag par ma byung bar mthong ba de'i tshe /

original: tshul bzhin mthong ngo //

analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba de'i tshe /

analyzed: tshul bzhi na mthong ngo //
translated: then he sees correctly.

original: de gang gis mthong ba de la yang rtog ste /
analyzed: de gang gis mthong ba de la yang rtog ste /

analyzed: ci nas kyang mi mthong ba dang / mi rtog pa de ltar mthong ste /

analyzed: de ltar mthong na tshul bzhin mthong ba zhes bya'o //

original: yang 'di ltar slob ste /
analyzed: yang 'di ltar slob ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul bzhin du sbyor ba ni /

analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: rgyal po chen po de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing /
translated: “Great king, in the same way, the thus-gone ones understand that all phenomena are free from afflictions

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar thugs su chud de /🔽de dag gis gang bsal bar bya ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar thugs su chud de / de dag gis gang bsal bar bya ba'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: and are like the sky.🔽They do not observe any phenomenon that is afflicted

original: rnam par byang ba gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: or purified.

original: rgyal po chen po ngas don gyi dbang 'di mthong nas khyod kyi 'gyod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis kyang bsal bar mi spyod do zhes de skad ces smras so //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po ngas don gyi dbang 'di mthong nas khyod kyi 'gyod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis kyang bsal bar mi spyod do zhes de skad ces smras so //
translated: “Great King, I have seen this fact, and therefore I say that even the Blessed Buddhas as many as the sands of the Ganges could not remove your remorse.”

original: gzhan yang rgyal po chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gang kun nas ldang ba'i sems nang nas kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyal po chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gang kun nas ldang ba'i sems nang nas kyang mi dmigs /
translated: Moreover, Great King, those Blessed Buddhas do not apprehend a thought of agitation even internally,

original: @196b gang kun nas ldang ba'i chos rnams phyi rol nas kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: @196b gang kun nas ldang ba'i chos rnams phyi rol nas kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor do they apprehend the phenomena of agitation even externally.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great King, it is because all phenomena are by nature free of agitation.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun nas ldang ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni kun nas ldang ba med pa ste /
translated: What is by nature free of agitation is not agitated.

original: gang kun nas ldang ba ni gnas med cing go skabs med pa'o ;
analyzed: gang kun nas ldang ba ni gnas med cing go skabs med pa'o ;
translated: What is agitated has no basis and no opportunity.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'o //
translated: Great King, all phenomena are isolated by their very essence.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad yongs su grub pa med pas ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad yongs su grub pa med pas ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are without inherent identity because they are not fully established.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'dre ba med pas yongs su grub pa med pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'byung ba med pas 'dre ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'dre ba med pas yongs su grub pa med pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'byung ba med pas 'dre ba med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are not fully established because they are not mixed.🔽Your Majesty, all phenomena are not mixed because they do not arise.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dngos po dang bral bas 'byung ba med pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bya ba'i mthu med pas dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dngos po dang bral bas 'byung ba med pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bya ba'i mthu med pas dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena do not arise because they are devoid of entities.🔽Your Majesty, all phenomena are devoid of entities because they are powerless to act.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bems po yin pas bya ba'i mthu med pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas bems po'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bems po yin pas bya ba'i mthu med pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas bems po'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are powerless to act because they are inert.🔽Your Majesty, all phenomena are inert because they are not characterized by awareness.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mi 'pho bas rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mi 'pho bas rnam par rig pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are not characterized by awareness because they are naturally unmoving.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'gro ba las log pas 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'gro ba las log pas 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are unmoving because they are free from going.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas 'gro ba med pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad skye ba med pas mi 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas 'gro ba med pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad skye ba med pas mi 'gyur ba'i chos can no //
translated: Your Majesty, since all phenomena are unchanging, they are without going.🔽Your Majesty, since all phenomena are unborn, they are unchanging.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'phel ba med pas skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'phel ba med pas skye ba med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, since all phenomena are without increase, they are unborn.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas 'brel pa med pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dag pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas 'brel pa med pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dag pas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Your Majesty, since all phenomena are naturally radiant, they are without connection.🔽Your Majesty, since all phenomena are pure, they are naturally radiant.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bla gab med pa dang 'dra bas dag pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad gnyen po med pas bla gab med pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bla gab med pa dang 'dra bas dag pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad gnyen po med pas bla gab med pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Your Majesty, since all phenomena are like an open sky, they are pure.🔽Your Majesty, since all phenomena are like an open sky, they are without a remedy.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad gnyis dang bral bas gnyen po med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad gnyis dang bral bas gnyen po med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, since all phenomena are free from duality, they are like an open sky.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mtha' rnam par spangs pas gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mtha' rnam par spangs pas gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: Your Majesty, since all phenomena are free from the extremes, they are free from duality.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mtha' med pas mtha' rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mtha' med pas mtha' rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are free from extremes, because they are limitless.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mu med pas mtha' yas pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mthar thug pa med pas mu med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mu med pas mtha' yas pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mthar thug pa med pas mu med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are limitless, because they are boundless.🔽Your Majesty, all phenomena are boundless, because they are endless.

original: @197a * // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dmigs pa med pas mthar thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: @197a * // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dmigs pa med pas mthar thug pa med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are endless, because they are baseless.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad phyin ci log med par so sor nye bar gnas pas nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad phyin ci log med par so sor nye bar gnas pas nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are baseless, because they are established without being established.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rtag pa dang / sdug pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag mi dmigs pas phyin ci log med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rtag pa dang / sdug pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag mi dmigs pas phyin ci log med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are without error, because they are not apprehended as permanent, pleasurable, a self, or a self’s property.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'bral ba med pa'i tshul gyis rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'bral ba med pa'i tshul gyis rtag pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are permanent, because they are not separated.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir sdug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir sdug pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are pleasurable, because they are naturally luminous.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ni rnam rtog med pa'i phyir bde ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ni rnam rtog med pa'i phyir bde ba'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are blissful because they are free from conceptualization.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bdag med par yongs su ston pa'i tshul gyis bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bdag med par yongs su ston pa'i tshul gyis bdag gi ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are essenceless because they are revealed to be selfless.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad nang nye bar zhi bas 'gyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad nang nye bar zhi bas 'gyod pa med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are free from regret because they are inwardly peaceful.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad don dam pa'i bden par rnam par gzhag pa med pas brdzun pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad don dam pa'i bden par rnam par gzhag pa med pas brdzun pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are false because they are not established in ultimate reality.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rab tu dang ba'i mtshan nyid pas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rab tu dang ba'i mtshan nyid pas zhi ba'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are peace because they are characterized by clarity.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bral bas nga yi ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad bdag gir 'dzin pa dang bral bas nga yi ba med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are insubstantial because they are free from the grasping of “mine.”

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid pas ro myang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid pas ro myang ba med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are without taste because they are characterized by liberation.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ming du btags pa med pas ming med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ming du btags pa med pas ming med pa'o //
translated: Your Majesty, all phenomena are nameless because they are not designated by names.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad tha dad pa ma yin pas dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad tha dad pa ma yin pas dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Great King, all phenomena are indivisible because they are not separate.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rnam par grol bar yang dag par 'du bas ro gcig pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i mtha' ste dben pa'i mtshan nyid do //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'jug pa med pas /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad rnam par grol bar yang dag par 'du bas ro gcig pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i mtha' ste dben pa'i mtshan nyid do // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'jug pa med pas /
translated: Great King, all phenomena are of one taste because they are subsumed in liberation.🔽Great King, all phenomena are characterized by isolation because they are the limit of signlessness.

original: dmigs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Great King, all phenomena are signless because they are free from reference points.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral bas dag pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dus gsum las shin tu 'das pas smon pa med pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba med pas /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang bral bas dag pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad dus gsum las shin tu 'das pas smon pa med pa'o // rgyal po chen po chos thams cad 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba med pas /
translated: Great King, all phenomena are pure because they are free from all views.🔽Great King, all phenomena are wishless because they are beyond the three times.

original: dus gsum du yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: Great King, all phenomena are cut off from the three times because they are beyond the past, present, and future.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes pas mya ngan las 'das par yang dag par 'du ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes pas mya ngan las 'das par yang dag par 'du ba'o //
translated: Great King, all phenomena are subsumed within nirvāṇa, because they are utterly unborn.

original: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Great King, what do you think?

original: chos gang ma skyes ma byung ba de kun @197b nas nyon mongs par bya nus sam /
analyzed: chos gang ma skyes ma byung ba de kun @197b nas nyon mongs par bya nus sam /
translated: Can a phenomenon that is unborn and unarisen be afflicted?”

original: smras pa 'jam dpal de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: smras pa 'jam dpal de ni mi nus so //
translated: He replied, “Mañjuśrī, it cannot.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: de bsal bar nus sam /
analyzed: de bsal bar nus sam /
translated: “Can it be removed?”

original: smras pa 'jam dpal de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: smras pa 'jam dpal de ni mi nus so //
translated: He replied, “Mañjuśrī, it cannot.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: rgyal po chen po de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par mkhyen to //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par mkhyen to //
translated: “Great King, in this way the thus-gone ones know that all phenomena are the same as nirvāṇa.

original: de bas na de dag gis the tshom bsal bar mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis the tshom bsal bar mi spyod do //
translated: Therefore, they do not engage in dispelling doubts.

original: de lta bas na rgyal po chen po khyod tshul bzhin la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyal po chen po khyod tshul bzhin la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Great King, therefore you should apply yourself to what is correct.

original: khyod phyin ci log med pa'i sems kyis yang dag par so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod phyin ci log med pa'i sems kyis yang dag par so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: With a mind free from error, you should accurately investigate.”

original: ji ltar so sor brtags na chos gang yang mi len mi 'dor la /
analyzed: ji ltar so sor brtags na chos gang yang mi len mi 'dor la /
translated: “When you investigate, you do not grasp at any dharma, you do not reject any dharma,🔽and you do not abide with any dharma.

original: chos gang dang yang lhan cig mi gnas pa de ltar khyod kyis so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang dang yang lhan cig mi gnas pa de ltar khyod kyis so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should investigate in that way.

original: gang chos thams cad dang mi gnas pa de ni shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad dang mi gnas pa de ni shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Whoever does not abide with any dharma is said to be ‘pliant.’

original: gang shin tu sbyangs pa de rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gang shin tu sbyangs pa de rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: Whoever is pliant is peaceful.

original: gang rab tu zhi ba de rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang rab tu zhi ba de rang bzhin no //
translated: Whoever is peaceful is natural.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Whoever is natural is without intrinsic nature.

original: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ni bdag med pas ma byas pa yin gyis de la khyod kyis bzod pa gyis shig //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos thams cad ni bdag med pas ma byas pa yin gyis de la khyod kyis bzod pa gyis shig //
translated: Great King, all dharmas are not made because they are selfless. You should be patient with that.

original: khyod kyis chos gang yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos gang yang mi bya'o //
translated: You should not make any dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rgyal po chen po mya ngan las 'das pa ni bya ba med pas te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po mya ngan las 'das pa ni bya ba med pas te /
translated: Great King, nirvāṇa is not made because it is not an action.

original: de la bya ba dang 'gyur bar bya ba'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la bya ba dang 'gyur bar bya ba'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: There is no dharma there that is an action or that causes action.

original: gang yang bya ba med cing 'gyur ba med pa de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang bya ba med cing 'gyur ba med pa de mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And that which is neither done nor transformed is called nirvana.

original: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgras brgya stong ri ba'i ras bcos bu zung gtsag blangs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po ma skyes dgras brgya stong ri ba'i ras bcos bu zung gtsag blangs te /
translated: Then King Ajatashatru took off his upper garment, which was worth a hundred thousand,

original: stan las langs nas /
analyzed: stan las langs nas /
translated: rose from his seat,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phul ba dang / des ma blangs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phul ba dang / des ma blangs so //
translated: and offered it to Manjushri, but the latter did not accept it.

original: de nas ma skyes dgras ras bcos bu zung de 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i lus la bor ro //
analyzed: de nas ma skyes dgras ras bcos bu zung de 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i lus la bor ro //
translated: Then Ajatashatru threw the upper garment over Manjushri's body.

original: ras bcos bu zung de 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i lus la bor ma thag tu de nas de'i mod kho na la 'jam dpal gyis rang gi lus mi snang bar byas so //
analyzed: ras bcos bu zung de 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i lus la bor ma thag tu de nas de'i mod kho na la 'jam dpal gyis rang gi lus mi snang bar byas so //
translated: As soon as he had thrown it over Manjushri's body, Manjushri immediately made his body invisible.

original: de nas rgyal pos 'jam dpal ni ma mthong gi /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos 'jam dpal ni ma mthong gi /
translated: Then the king, not seeing Manjushri,

original: steng gi bar snang las rgyal po chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i lus ji ltar ma mthong ba de bzhin du 'gyod pa de la ltos shig /'gyod pa de ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad la ltos shig //
analyzed: steng gi bar snang las rgyal po chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i lus ji ltar ma mthong ba de bzhin du 'gyod pa de la ltos shig /'gyod pa de ji lta ba bzhin du chos thams cad la ltos shig //
translated: In the sky above, a voice said, “Great King, look at the regret you have for not seeing the body of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta. Look at all phenomena in the same way as you regret.

original: chos thams cad ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du gos la ltos shig //🔽gang gis mthong ba de la yang de bzhin @198a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du gos la ltos shig // gang gis mthong ba de la yang de bzhin @198a * //
translated: Look at your clothes in the same way you see all phenomena.🔽Look at the one who sees in the same way as that. Great King, give the pair of garments to the one whose body you see.”

original: du ltos shig / rgyal po chen po su'i lus mthong ba de la ras bcos bu zung de phul shig ces sgra zhig thos pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / slas dang / bud med kyi 'khor ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyi lus la ras bcos bu zung de dbul bar byas pa dang /
analyzed: du ltos shig / rgyal po chen po su'i lus mthong ba de la ras bcos bu zung de phul shig ces sgra zhig thos pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / slas dang / bud med kyi 'khor ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyi lus la ras bcos bu zung de dbul bar byas pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, consorts, and retinue of women all offered the pair of garments to their bodies,

original: de dag kyang ma mthong nas ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu de la mngon sum du gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang ma mthong nas ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu de la mngon sum du gyur te /
translated: but they could not be seen. They directly perceived this kind of samādhi.

original: rang gi lus la 'du shes 'byung ba ma gtogs par gzugs ci yang mig gis mthong ba la snang bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: rang gi lus la 'du shes 'byung ba ma gtogs par gzugs ci yang mig gis mthong ba la snang bar ma gyur to //
translated: Except for the perception of his own body, he did not see any form at all.

original: yang su'i lus mthong ba de la ras bcos bu zung nge byin cig ces de skad kyi sgra zhig kyang thos nas /
analyzed: yang su'i lus mthong ba de la ras bcos bu zung nge byin cig ces de skad kyi sgra zhig kyang thos nas /
translated: He heard a voice say, “Give a pair of fine garments to whoever you see.”

original: de ras bcos bu zung de bgo'o snyam pa dang / rang gi lus kyang ma mthong nas /
analyzed: de ras bcos bu zung de bgo'o snyam pa dang / rang gi lus kyang ma mthong nas /
translated: He thought, “I will give a pair of fine garments to whoever I see,” but he did not see his own body.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes thams cad dang bral lo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes thams cad dang bral lo //
translated: He was free from all perceptions of form.
