analyzed: 'jam dpal gtsub shing gi gtam ma yin pa'i gtam gang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is the discourse that is not the discourse of the fire-drill?

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: lha'i bu gtam gang skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa'i gtam ma yin pa dang / 'dren pa dang / sel ba'i gtam ma yin pa dang / gtam gang kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su brjod pa'i gtam ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu gtam gang skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa'i gtam ma yin pa dang / 'dren pa dang / sel ba'i gtam ma yin pa dang / gtam gang kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su brjod pa'i gtam ma yin pa dang /
translated: Divine son, any discourse that is not a discourse on arising, ceasing, and abiding, that is not a discourse on leading or dispelling, and any discourse that is not a discourse on the expression of the afflictions,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phan yon gyi gtam ma yin pa dang / gtam gang 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i gtam ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i gtam dang / gtam gang yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phan yon gyi gtam ma yin pa dang / gtam gang 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i gtam ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i gtam dang / gtam gang yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not a discourse on the attainment of knowledge,

original: spang @200a * //🔽bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: spang @200a * // bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: on the abandonment of afflictions,

original: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: on the cultivation of antidotes,🔽or on the realization of the fruits.

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / gtam gang thob par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa dang / gtam gang thob par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not a discourse on the attainment of the fruits or on the realization of the fruits.

original: mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa 'di ni lha'i bu dag snying po yod pa'i gtam mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa 'di ni lha'i bu dag snying po yod pa'i gtam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Divine princes, this is a discourse on the essence.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med cing sems pa med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med cing sems pa med pa /
translated: All phenomena are non-apprehensible and non-conceptual.

original: rin po che bsags pa bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: rin po che bsags pa bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Heap of Jewels Sutra also says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Tathagata said to Manjushri:

original: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings /
analyzed: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the inconceivable realm.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zhes bya ba la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba de gang yin /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zhes bya ba la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba de gang yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is this so-called inconceivable realm?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: “Blessed One, the so-called inconceivable realm

original: dbyings gang sems ma mchis pa sems grol bar bgyi ma lags pa /
analyzed: dbyings gang sems ma mchis pa sems grol bar bgyi ma lags pa /
translated: is a realm that is not mind, that is not liberated mind,

original: sems kyis dpag par bgyi ba ma lags pa /
analyzed: sems kyis dpag par bgyi ba ma lags pa /
translated: that is not to be fathomed by mind,

original: bsam pas rab tu dbye bar bgyi ba ma lags pa lags mod kyi /
analyzed: bsam pas rab tu dbye bar bgyi ba ma lags pa lags mod kyi /
translated: and that is not to be distinguished by thought.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das sems nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das sems nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so //
translated: Nevertheless, Blessed One, the mind itself is the inconceivable realm.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems la sems ma mchis pa ma lags kyi /
analyzed: sems la sems ma mchis pa ma lags kyi /
translated: It is not that mind is not mind,

original: sems nyid sems ma lags pas /
analyzed: sems nyid sems ma lags pas /
translated: but that mind itself is not mind.

original: sems ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni ngo bo nyid kyis ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Mind is essentially nonexistent.

original: sems ji lta ba bzhin pas /
analyzed: sems ji lta ba bzhin pas /
translated: Since mind is just as it is,

original: sems ma mchis pa nyid sems ma lags te /
analyzed: sems ma mchis pa nyid sems ma lags te /
translated: mindlessness is not mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Blessed One, this is the inconceivable realm.

original: yang mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: yang mdo de nyid las /
translated: Again, the same sūtra says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Tathāgata said,

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis 'di ltar bdag gis sems can gdul lo snyam pa'i go cha ma bgos sam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis 'di ltar bdag gis sems can gdul lo snyam pa'i go cha ma bgos sam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, have you not put on the armor thinking, ‘I will tame sentient beings’?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams ni bri ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi khams ni bri ba'am /
translated: “Blessed One, the realm of sentient beings is neither diminished

original: gang bar mi gda' na /
analyzed: gang bar mi gda' na /
translated: nor filled.

original: de ji ltar sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur /
translated: How then will sentient beings be tamed?

original: yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar 'gyur /
translated: How will they be led to complete nirvana?

original: bcom ldan 'das gang dag sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i slad du /🔽yang dag par zhugs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag sems can gyi khams 'dul ba'i slad du / yang dag par zhugs pa de dag ni /
translated: Blessed One, those who engage in taming the realm of sentient beings

original: nam mkha' 'dul bar yang dag par zhugs pa lags so //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'dul bar yang dag par zhugs pa lags so //
translated: are engaged in taming space.

original: gang dag sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba /
analyzed: gang dag sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba /
translated: Those who apply themselves to taming sentient beings

original: de dag ni byang chub gdul bar 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub gdul bar 'tshal ba'o //
translated: seek to tame awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni byang chub lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni byang chub lags te /
translated: Blessed One, all phenomena are awakening.

original: bcom @200b ldan 'das byang chub ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom @200b ldan 'das byang chub ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Blessed One, awakening is not afflicted,

original: rnam par byang ba ma lags so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma lags so //
translated: nor is it purified.

original: de'i slad du /
analyzed: de'i slad du /
translated: Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod sems can 'dul ba'i phyir yang dag par ma zhugs sam /🔽zhes de skad bka' stsal te /🔽bcom ldan 'das bdag ni sems can 'dul pa'i slad du'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal khyod sems can 'dul ba'i phyir yang dag par ma zhugs sam / zhes de skad bka' stsal te / bcom ldan 'das bdag ni sems can 'dul pa'i slad du'am /
translated: the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī, “You have not set out to train sentient beings?”🔽“Blessed One,” he replied, “I have not set out to train sentient beings

original: sems can kun nas nyon mongs par bgyi ba'i slad du yang dag par ma zhugs so //
analyzed: sems can kun nas nyon mongs par bgyi ba'i slad du yang dag par ma zhugs so //
translated: or to afflict sentient beings.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can zhig mchis na ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can zhig mchis na ni /
translated: Blessed One, if there were any sentient beings,

original: sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sems can rnam par byang bas rab tu phye bar yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / sems can rnam par byang bas rab tu phye bar yang 'gyur na /
translated: then there would be sentient beings distinguished by affliction and purification.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can ma mchis pas sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas rab tu phye ba ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can ma mchis pas sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas rab tu phye ba ma lags so //
translated: But, Blessed One, since there are no sentient beings, there are no sentient beings distinguished by affliction and purification.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba lags so //
translated: Blessed One, in this way, it is not in contradiction with dependent origination.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lags /
translated: Blessed One, if it does not exist, there is no defilement,

original: rnam par bya ba ma lags te /
analyzed: rnam par bya ba ma lags te /
translated: and there is no purification.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'o /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'o /
translated: Blessed One, all phenomena are dependently arisen and therefore lack intrinsic existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Blessed One, that which is defiled or

original: rnam par byang ba de ni rten nas 'byung ba'i don te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba de ni rten nas 'byung ba'i don te /
translated: purified is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: ma mchis pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of nonexistence.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i don ni rten te 'byung ba'i don du mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i don ni rten te 'byung ba'i don du mkhas pa rnams kyis rtogs te /
translated: Blessed One, the meaning of nonexistence is understood by the wise as the meaning of dependent origination.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni ma mchis brten de 'byung ba'i don to snyam du de ltar rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni ma mchis brten de 'byung ba'i don to snyam du de ltar rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: The wise do not conceptualize in this way: ‘Nonexistence is the meaning of dependent origination.’

original: gang la rnam par mi rtog pa'i don de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: gang la rnam par mi rtog pa'i don de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Where there is the meaning of nonconceptuality, there is no defilement

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis so //
translated: and no purification.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper na sgyu ma bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma bgyid pa'am /
translated: For example, it is like a magician🔽

original: sgyu ma bgyid pa'i slob mas khang pa brtsegs pa'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma bgyid pa'i slob mas khang pa brtsegs pa'am /
translated: For example, Blessed One, a magician or a magician’s apprentice might conjure up a multi-storied building,🔽or a multi-storied building with a roof-top terrace,

original: khang pa brtsegs pa rgyud mo 'bar rab tu 'bar kun tu 'bar te /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa rgyud mo 'bar rab tu 'bar kun tu 'bar te /
translated: which is ablaze, burning, and glowing.

original: me lce mched par gyur pa mngon par sprul pa de la mi la la zhig 'di ltar bdag gi khang pa brtsegs pa'am /
analyzed: me lce mched par gyur pa mngon par sprul pa de la mi la la zhig 'di ltar bdag gi khang pa brtsegs pa'am /
translated: If someone were to think, ‘I will extinguish the multi-storied building,

original: khang pa brtsegs pa rgyud mo 'bar rab tu 'bar kun tu rab tu 'bar te /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa rgyud mo 'bar rab tu 'bar kun tu rab tu 'bar te /
translated: or the multi-storied building with a roof-top terrace, which is ablaze, burning, and glowing,🔽and the spreading flames,’

original: me lce mched par gyur pa dgum par bgyi'o snyam nas /🔽go cha 'tshal na /
analyzed: me lce mched par gyur pa dgum par bgyi'o snyam nas / go cha 'tshal na /
translated: and were to don armor,

original: bcom ldan 'das mi de 'di ltar bgegs dang / nyon mongs pa'i skal pa can du mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi de 'di ltar bgegs dang / nyon mongs pa'i skal pa can du mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Blessed One, would that person not be destined for misfortune and hardship?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal de de bzhin no //🔽'jam @201a * //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de de bzhin no // 'jam @201a * //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is so.

original: dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de de lta lags te /
translated: “Blessed One, it is so.

original: gang sems can gdul ba'i slad du /
analyzed: gang sems can gdul ba'i slad du /
translated: For the sake of training sentient beings,

original: go cha 'tshal ba de ni bgegs dang / nyon mongs pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba lags so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: go cha 'tshal ba de ni bgegs dang / nyon mongs pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba lags so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the misfortune of those who don the armor to encounter obstacles and afflictions.

original: yang mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: yang mdo de nyid las /
translated: Again, the same sūtra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'jam dpal yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'jam dpal yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba de /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: chos gang gi tshig bla dags yin /
analyzed: chos gang gi tshig bla dags yin /
translated: Mañjuśrī, what is the meaning of the term “correct analytical discrimination”?

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba ni /🔽so sor rtog pa dang / chos gang la yang tha dad par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba ni / so sor rtog pa dang / chos gang la yang tha dad par yang mi bgyid /
translated: Blessed One, “correct analytical discrimination” means

original: gcig tu yang mi bgyid de ;
analyzed: gcig tu yang mi bgyid de ;
translated: not making distinctions among any phenomena and not making them unitary.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'gyur ba ma mchis pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'gyur ba ma mchis pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, because it is unchanging, it is nonconceptual.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni /
translated: Blessed One, this “correct analytical discrimination”

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dgas so //
translated: is a term for the absence of correct analytical discrimination.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa la brten te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa la brten te /
translated: Blessed One, based on correct analytical discrimination,

original: bdag ni so so'i skye bo'am /
analyzed: bdag ni so so'i skye bo'am /
translated: one does not think, “I am an ordinary being,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos snyam du de ltar mi sems so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos snyam du de ltar mi sems so //
translated: He does not think, ‘I am a noble śrāvaka.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽'di ltar chos gang so so'i skye bo'am /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di ltar chos gang so so'i skye bo'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because he does not see any dharma that is an ordinary person,

original: 'phags par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'phags par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: or that is a noble one.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa la brten nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag par so sor rtog pa la brten nas /
translated: Blessed One, relying on right discrimination,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: a son of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis de ltar gnas pa lags te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis de ltar gnas pa lags te /
translated: or a daughter of a good family, by means of the principle of the dharma-constituent, abides in that way.

original: chos gang la yang mnyam pa nyid du yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: chos gang la yang mnyam pa nyid du yang mi bgyid /
translated: He does not make any dharma equal,

original: mi mnyam par yang mi bgyid /
analyzed: mi mnyam par yang mi bgyid /
translated: nor does he make it unequal.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos ni mi mnyam pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi bgyid /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos ni mi mnyam pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi bgyid /
translated: He does not think, ‘The dharmas of an ordinary person are unequal,’

original: 'phags pa'i chos ni mnyam pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos ni mnyam pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par mi bgyid do //
translated: nor does he think, ‘The dharmas of a noble one are equal.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /🔽'di ltar dmigs pa gang mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di ltar dmigs pa gang mnyam pa'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because he does not apprehend any object that he would make equal

original: mi mnyam par bgyid pa de mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam par bgyid pa de mi dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
translated: or unequal.🔽He does not apprehend any dharma by which he would make it equal

original: gang gis mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis mnyam pa'am /
translated: or unequal.

original: mi mnyam par bgyid pa de yang dge slong de la ma mchis so //
analyzed: mi mnyam par bgyid pa de yang dge slong de la ma mchis so //
translated: That monk does not engage in any inequality.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i dge slong ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i dge slong ni /
translated: Thus, a monk who is nonconceptual

original: bdag rnam par mi rtog go snyam du de ltar 'dzin pa yang ma mchis so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag rnam par mi rtog go snyam du de ltar 'dzin pa yang ma mchis so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: does not think, ‘I am nonconceptual.’🔽And in the Teaching of Vimalakīrti,

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang /
translated: it says,

original: nad kyi gzhi de gang zhe na /
analyzed: nad kyi gzhi de gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the basis of illness?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lhag par dmigs pa ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: lhag par dmigs pa ni gzhi'o //
translated: The basis is the observation of something in excess.

original: lhag par dmigs pa'i gzhi la /
analyzed: lhag par dmigs pa'i gzhi la /
translated: The basis of the observation of something in excess

original: ji tsam du dmigs pa de tsam du nad kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du dmigs pa de tsam du nad kyi gzhi'o //
translated: is the basis of illness to the extent that there is observation.

original: ci la lhag par dmigs @201b she na /
analyzed: ci la lhag par dmigs @201b she na /
translated: What is observed in excess?

original: khams gsum la lhag par dmigs so //
analyzed: khams gsum la lhag par dmigs so //
translated: The three realms are observed in excess.

original: lhag par dmigs pa'i gzhi yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhag par dmigs pa'i gzhi yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of the basis of the observation of something in excess?

original: dmigs pa med cing mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med cing mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of observation and nonobservation.

original: gang mi dmigs pa de ni lhag par mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa de ni lhag par mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: That which is not observed is not observed in excess.

original: ci mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: ci mi dmigs she na /
translated: What is not observed?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / pha rol tu lta ba dang / lta ba gnyis su mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / pha rol tu lta ba dang / lta ba gnyis su mi dmigs te /
translated: The view of self and the view of other are not observed as two.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //

translated: Blessed One, just as a very valuable jewel wrapped in dirty rags would be defiled by the smell of the rags, so the Tathāgata-essence is wrapped in the rags of the aggregates, elements, and sense-media, and is defiled by the smell of the stains of desire, hatred, and ignorance, and by the stains of conceptualization.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: Mahāmati, the tathāgatas, arhats, and samyaksaṃbuddhas, in order to teach the meanings of terms such as emptiness, the perfect limit, nirvāṇa, nonarising, signlessness, and wishlessness, teach the tathāgatagarbha.

original: byis pa rnams bdag med pas 'jig par 'gyur ba'i gnas rnam par spang ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sgo bstan pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ston te /

translated: In order to prevent the childish from being destroyed by selflessness, they teach the gateway of the tathāgatagarbha. They teach the nonconceptual state, the domain of nonappearance.

original: 'di la blo gros chen po ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bdag tu mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //

original: blo gros chen po dper na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po dper na /
translated: Mahāmati, it is like this:

analyzed: snod rnam pa sna tshogs byed do //

translated: Mahāmati, in the same way, the Tathāgatas, with the suchness of the selflessness of phenomena, the reversal of all characteristics of conceptualization, with various skillful means of wisdom and methods, teach the tathāgatagarbha🔽.

original: bdag med par bstan pas kyang rung ste rdza mkhan bzhin du tshig dang yi ge'i rnam grangs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston te des na de'i phyir blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa mu stegs byed kyi bdag tu smra ba bstan pa🔽dang mi 'dra'o //

translated: It is also suitable to teach it as selflessness. Like a potter, [the Buddha] teaches with various enumerations of words and letters. Therefore, Mahamati, the teaching of the tathiigata essence is not the same as the tirthikas' teaching of self.

original: blo gros chen po de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mu stegs byed bdag tu smra ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams drang ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ston te /

translated: Those with the intention of falling into the view of conceptualizing an unreal self will quickly attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment through the intention of abiding in the sphere of the three liberations.
