original: blo gros chen po de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ston par mdzad do //
translated: Mahāmati, for that purpose the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones teach the Tathāgatagarbha.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni mu stegs byed bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni mu stegs byed bdag tu smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not the same as the tīrthikas’ doctrine of self.

original: blo gros chen po de bas na mu stegs byed kyi lta ba rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir /🔽de bzhin gshegs @205a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bas na mu stegs byed kyi lta ba rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir / de bzhin gshegs @205a * //
translated: Mahāmati, therefore, in order to turn away from the tīrthikas’ views,🔽one should follow the Tathāgatagarbha

original: pa'i snying po bdag med pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i snying po bdag med pa'i rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: which is without self.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos stong pa nyid dang skye ba med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa dang rang bzhin med par bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: chos stong pa nyid dang skye ba med pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa dang rang bzhin med par bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' bla na med pa'o //
translated: This teaching on the emptiness, non-arising, non-duality, and essencelessness of phenomena is the unsurpassed philosophy of the bodhisattvas.

original: chos zab mo bstan pa 'di yongs su bzung bas theg pa chen po'i mdo sde thams cad yongs su bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: chos zab mo bstan pa 'di yongs su bzung bas theg pa chen po'i mdo sde thams cad yongs su bzung ba yin te /
translated: By upholding this teaching of the profound Dharma, all the sūtras of the Great Vehicle are upheld.

original: 'di ltar chos zab mo bstan pa 'di ni mdo sde thams cad kyi nang du 'dus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos zab mo bstan pa 'di ni mdo sde thams cad kyi nang du 'dus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this way, this teaching of the profound Dharma is included in all the sūtras.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa de nyid las bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa de nyid las bka' stsal pa /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavat said in the very same Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra:

original: blo gros chen po stong pa nyid dang skye ba med pa dang gnyis ma yin pa dang rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mdo sde'i nang du 'dus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po stong pa nyid dang skye ba med pa dang gnyis ma yin pa dang rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mdo sde'i nang du 'dus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Mahāmati, the characteristics of emptiness, non-arising, non-duality, and absence of intrinsic nature are included in the sūtras of all the Buddhas.

original: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma'i mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
translated: And in the verse of the Candrapradīpa Sūtra it is said:

original: 'jig rten khams ni stong dag tu //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni stong dag tu //
translated: In the thousand world systems,

original: ngas ni mdo sde gang bshad pa //
analyzed: ngas ni mdo sde gang bshad pa //
translated: the sūtras I have taught

original: tshig 'bru tha dad don gcig ste //
analyzed: tshig 'bru tha dad don gcig ste //
translated: have different words but the same meaning;

original: thams cad brjod par nus ma yin //
analyzed: thams cad brjod par nus ma yin //
translated: all of them cannot be expressed.

original: tshig gcig rnam par bsgoms na ni //
analyzed: tshig gcig rnam par bsgoms na ni //
translated: If one meditates on a single word,

original: de dag thams cad bsgom par 'gyur //🔽sangs rgyas ji snyed thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsgom par 'gyur // sangs rgyas ji snyed thams cad kyis //
translated: All of them are cultivated.🔽All the many dharmas

original: chos rnams mang po rab bshad pa //
analyzed: chos rnams mang po rab bshad pa //
translated: That are taught by all the buddhas

original: chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid //
translated: Are the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽For those who are skilled in the meaning,

original: mi gang don la mkhas pa dag / tshig 'di bslabs par gyur pa la //
analyzed: mi gang don la mkhas pa dag / tshig 'di bslabs par gyur pa la //
translated: These words are the training.

original: sangs rgyas chos rnams dkon ma yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams dkon ma yin //
translated: The buddhas’ dharmas are not rare.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: chos zab mo la mos pas /
analyzed: chos zab mo la mos pas /
translated: By being interested in the profound Dharma,

original: bsod nams thams cad bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad bsdus pa yin te /
translated: all merit is included.

original: sangs rgyas sum grub kyi bar du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sum grub kyi bar du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Until buddhahood is attained, all mundane and supramundane perfections will be accomplished.

original: khye'u rin po ches byin pa'i mdo las 'byung ba /
analyzed: khye'u rin po ches byin pa'i mdo las 'byung ba /
translated: This is taught in the Sūtra of the Gift of the Precious Boy:

original: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bas bskal pa brgya stong du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa bas gang gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di the tshom dang bcas pas nyan pa'i bsod nams mang du bskyed na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bas bskal pa brgya stong du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa bas gang gis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di the tshom dang bcas pas nyan pa'i bsod nams mang du bskyed na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who lacks skill in means may practice the six perfections for a hundred thousand eons, but if someone else listens to this Dharma discourse with doubt, he will generate much more merit.

original: gang the tshom med par nyan pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang the tshom med par nyan pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention someone who listens without doubt?

original: yang yi ge bris nas lung 'bogs pa dang / 'chang ba dang gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang yi ge bris nas lung 'bogs pa dang / 'chang ba dang gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs so //
translated: What need is there to mention someone who writes it down, recites it, keeps it, and teaches it extensively to others?

original: rdo rje gcod pa las kyang /
analyzed: rdo rje gcod pa las kyang /
translated: The Diamond Cutter Sutra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed @205b pa gang g'a'i klung yang de snyed du gyur na /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed @205b pa gang g'a'i klung yang de snyed du gyur na /
translated: If there were as many Ganges Rivers as there are sand grains in the Ganges River,

original: gang de dag gi bye mar gyur pa de mang ba yin nam /
analyzed: gang de dag gi bye mar gyur pa de mang ba yin nam /
translated: would the sand grains in those Ganges Rivers be many?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung du gyur pa de dag nyid kyang mang ba lags na de dag gi bye ma lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung du gyur pa de dag nyid kyang mang ba lags na de dag gi bye ma lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Blessed One, the Ganges itself is a lot, let alone its sands.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor khyod la bsgo'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod la bsgo'o //
translated: “Subhūti, I tell you,

original: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //🔽gang g'a'i de dag gi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams skyes pa 'am /
analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o // gang g'a'i de dag gi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams skyes pa 'am /
translated: you should understand this:

original: bud med la las rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu bkang ste /
analyzed: bud med la las rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu bkang ste /
translated: If as many world systems as there are grains of sand in those Ganges rivers were filled with the seven precious substances

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sbyin pa byin na skyes pa'am bud med de gzhi de las bsod nams mang du bskyed dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sbyin pa byin na skyes pa'am bud med de gzhi de las bsod nams mang du bskyed dam /
translated: and a man or woman were to give them as a gift to the Tathāgata, would that man or woman generate a lot of merit on that basis?🔽”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das mang lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, it would be a lot.

original: bde bar gshegs pa mang lags so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa mang lags so //
translated: Well-Gone One, it would be a lot.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang zhig chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tha na tshig tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su pa tsam bzung ste /
analyzed: gang zhig chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las tha na tshig tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su pa tsam bzung ste /
translated: “If someone were to take up even just a verse of four lines from this Dharma discourse,

original: gzhan dag la yang bstan na /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang bstan na /
translated: If it is taught to others,

original: de bas bsod nams ches mang du bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas bsod nams ches mang du bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: even more merit is produced.

original: tshangs pas zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: tshangs pas zhus pa las kyang /
translated: Also, in the Brahma's Net Sutra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs te /
translated: the Tathagata said:

original: grogs po dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bsod nams 'dod pas de bzhin du rnyed pa dad gzugs dang longs spyod dang g-yog 'khor dang chos kyi dbang phyug dang lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bar thams cad 'dod pas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan
analyzed: grogs po dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bsod nams 'dod pas de bzhin du rnyed pa dad gzugs dang longs spyod dang g-yog 'khor dang chos kyi dbang phyug dang lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa'i bar thams cad 'dod pas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan
translated: Friends, sons or daughters of good lineage who desire merit, in that way, those who desire all the attainments of wealth, form, enjoyment, retinue, mastery of the Dharma, and the perfections of gods and humans, should listen to this Dharma teaching,

original: par bya mos par bya gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: par bya mos par bya gzung bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: should aspire to it, and should uphold it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sh'a ri'i bus gsol ba /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las sh'a ri'i bus gsol ba /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom, Shariputra said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mos pa'i sems can de dag byang chub tu ngas par 'gyur ba lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mos pa'i sems can de dag byang chub tu ngas par 'gyur ba lags so //
translated: Bhagavan, those sentient beings who, having heard this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, aspire to it, will be born in the lineage of the Tathagata.

original: byams pas gsol pa /
analyzed: byams pas gsol pa /
translated: Maitreya said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, those bodhisattvas who, having heard this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, aspire to it, they will approach awakening.

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni /
translated: Blessed One, those bodhisattvas who, having heard this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, aspire to it,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du lta bar bgyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du lta bar bgyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: they will see buddhahood.

original: chos zab mo la mos pa 'di ltung ba dang 'gyod pa thams cad sel ba dang / las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur te /🔽de @206a * //
analyzed: chos zab mo la mos pa 'di ltung ba dang 'gyod pa thams cad sel ba dang / las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur te / de @206a * //
translated: This aspiration to the profound Dharma eliminates all downfalls and regrets, and purifies all karmic obscurations.

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod kyi mdo las 'byung ba /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod kyi mdo las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Tathāgatakośa Sūtra:

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: pha yang yin la rang sangs rgyas kyang yin pa de'i srog bcad na de ni srog bcad pa'i nang na chen po'o //
analyzed: pha yang yin la rang sangs rgyas kyang yin pa de'i srog bcad na de ni srog bcad pa'i nang na chen po'o //
translated: If one were to kill one’s father, who is also a pratyekabuddha, that would be the greatest killing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku ba 'di ni ma byin par len pa'i nang na chen po'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku ba 'di ni ma byin par len pa'i nang na chen po'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: Stealing the property of the Three Jewels is the most serious of all forms of taking what is not given.

original: ma yang yin la dgra bcom ma yang yin pa de la log par spyad pa de ni 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa rnams kyi nang na chen po'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma yang yin la dgra bcom ma yang yin pa de la log par spyad pa de ni 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa rnams kyi nang na chen po'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: Having sexual relations with a woman who is both your mother and an arhat is the most serious of all forms of sexual misconduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba 'debs pa 'di ni brdzun du smra ba'i nang na chen po'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la skur ba 'debs pa 'di ni brdzun du smra ba'i nang na chen po'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: Slandering the Tathāgata is the most serious of all forms of lying.

original: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mi snyan pa brjod pa 'di ni phra ma'i nang na chen po'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la mi snyan pa brjod pa 'di ni phra ma'i nang na chen po'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: Speaking unpleasantly about the noble Saṅgha is the most serious of all forms of divisive speech.

original: 'phags pa rnams la co 'dri ba 'di ni tshig rtsub po'i nang na chen po'o //🔽'di lta ste /🔽chos 'dod pa rnams la rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'di ni tshig kyal ba rnams kyi nang na chen po'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la co 'dri ba 'di ni tshig rtsub po'i nang na chen po'o // 'di lta ste / chos 'dod pa rnams la rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'di ni tshig kyal ba rnams kyi nang na chen po'o //
translated: Mocking the noble ones is the most serious of all forms of harsh speech.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Disturbing those who wish to practice the Dharma is the most serious of all forms of idle chatter.

original: mtshams med pa byed par shom pa 'di ni gnod sems kyi nang na chen po'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed par shom pa 'di ni gnod sems kyi nang na chen po'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: The greatest of the harmful thoughts is the one that is ready to commit the crimes with universal retribution.

original: yang dag par song ba dang yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnyed pa 'phrog pa'i sems 'di ni brnab sems kyi nang na chen po'o //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par song ba dang yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnyed pa 'phrog pa'i sems 'di ni brnab sems kyi nang na chen po'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: The greatest of the covetous thoughts is the one that steals the property of those who are on the right path and who are practicing the right path.

original: lta bas gzings pa 'di ni log pa'i lta ba'i nang na chen po'o //
analyzed: lta bas gzings pa 'di ni log pa'i lta ba'i nang na chen po'o //
translated: The greatest of the wrong views is the view that denies cause and effect.

original: 'od srungs mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag thams cad ni kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag thams cad ni kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, all these ten unwholesome courses of action are grave sins.

original: 'od srungs gal te sems can gcig cig mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa 'di dag dang ldan par gyur la de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu dang rkyen du ldan pa'i chos bstan pa la 'jug ste 'di
analyzed: 'od srungs gal te sems can gcig cig mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa 'di dag dang ldan par gyur la de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu dang rkyen du ldan pa'i chos bstan pa la 'jug ste 'di
translated: Kāśyapa, if a sentient being were to possess all these ten unwholesome courses of action that are grave sins, and if that person were to enter the Tathāgata’s teaching on the Dharma of causes and conditions,

original: la gang byed pa'am gang tshor bar byed pa'i bdag gam /
analyzed: la gang byed pa'am gang tshor bar byed pa'i bdag gam /
translated: then there would be no self that acts or experiences the results of actions.

original: sems can nam srog gam gang zag gang yang med do //
analyzed: sems can nam srog gam gang zag gang yang med do //
translated: There is no sentient being, no life-force, and no person.

original: zhes de ltar ma byas par mngon par 'dus ma byas pa med pa sgyu ma'i chos nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos thams cad la 'jug cing /
analyzed: zhes de ltar ma byas par mngon par 'dus ma byas pa med pa sgyu ma'i chos nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos thams cad la 'jug cing /
translated: ” In this way, without engaging in any mental activity, they enter into the illusory nature of phenomena, which is devoid of any mental activity, free from afflictive emotions, and naturally radiant.

original: chos thams cad thog ma nas dag par mngon par dad pa dang / mos pa'i sems can de ngan song du 'gro zhes nga mi smra'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad thog ma nas dag par mngon par dad pa dang / mos pa'i sems can de ngan song du 'gro zhes nga mi smra'o //
translated: I do not say that sentient beings who have faith in and are devoted to the primordially pure nature of all phenomena will go to the lower realms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi phung po dngos po med de nyon mongs pa thams cad skyes nas 'jig cing 'ju'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi phung po dngos po med de nyon mongs pa thams cad skyes nas 'jig cing 'ju'o //
translated: The aggregates of afflictive emotions are unreal. All afflictive emotions arise, disintegrate, and pass away.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i 'du 'phrod las skye ste skyes @206b ma thag tu 'gag go //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i 'du 'phrod las skye ste skyes @206b ma thag tu 'gag go //
translated: They arise from the convergence of causes and conditions, and as soon as they arise, they cease.

original: gang sems skye ba'i 'jig pa de nyid nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: gang sems skye ba'i 'jig pa de nyid nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi 'jig pa ste /
translated: The disintegration of the mind is the disintegration of all afflictive emotions.

original: gang de ltar mos pa de la ltung ba gang yang med cing ltung ba'i gnas med de gnas ma yin zhing skabs med do //
analyzed: gang de ltar mos pa de la ltung ba gang yang med cing ltung ba'i gnas med de gnas ma yin zhing skabs med do //
translated: Those who have such conviction have no downfalls at all, and no basis for downfalls. It is not possible for them to have downfalls.

original: gang gi sgrib pa med pa la ltung ba gnas pa de ni gnas ma yin no zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: gang gi sgrib pa med pa la ltung ba gnas pa de ni gnas ma yin no zhes gsungs so ;
translated: It is not possible for downfalls to occur in those who are free of obscurations.

original: / bdud btul ba'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: / bdud btul ba'i le'u las kyang /
translated: The chapter on the subjugation of Mara in the Sutra of the Questions of Ratnachuda also says:

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa nye ba 'khor gyis dris pa /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa nye ba 'khor gyis dris pa /
translated: Upali, the upholder of the monastic code, asked:

original: sdig can ji ltar na dge slong 'dul ba 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: sdig can ji ltar na dge slong 'dul ba 'dzin pa yin /
translated: “Evil one, how is a monk an upholder of the monastic code?”

original: bdud kyis smras pa /
analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa /
translated: Mara replied:

original: btsun pa nye ba 'khor dge slong gis nam chos thams cad shin tu dul bar shes te /
analyzed: btsun pa nye ba 'khor dge slong gis nam chos thams cad shin tu dul bar shes te /
translated: “Venerable Upali, a monk is an upholder of the monastic code when he knows that all phenomena are well disciplined.

original: nyes pa rnams kyi thog ma'i sngon gyi mtha' yang dben pa'i mthar shes /🔽nyes pa byung ba rnams kyi 'gyod pa yang sel cing brtan por mi byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi thog ma'i sngon gyi mtha' yang dben pa'i mthar shes / nyes pa byung ba rnams kyi 'gyod pa yang sel cing brtan por mi byed de /
translated: He knows that the original beginning of faults is in the extreme of seclusion.🔽He regrets the faults that have occurred and does not stabilize them.🔽If he conquers even the heinous crimes,

original: de dag la gang gis mtshams med pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon na /🔽cho ga dang tshul khrims la log par zhugs pa /
analyzed: de dag la gang gis mtshams med pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon na /🔽cho ga dang tshul khrims la log par zhugs pa /
translated: what need is there to mention minor faults?

original: phran tshegs lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de lta bu'i chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa yang nye bar bsgrub nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la yang mkhas glo bur du nyon mongs pa rnams la yang kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: phran tshegs lta smos kyang ci dgos pa de lta bu'i chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa yang nye bar bsgrub nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la yang mkhas glo bur du nyon mongs pa rnams la yang kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: They will also accomplish the way of the Dharma, which is to be skilled in subduing the afflictions, and not be afflicted by the sudden arising of the afflictions.

original: 'byung bar 'du shes pa nyon mongs pa nang du yang ma bton phyi rol du yang ma yin gnyi ga med par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'du shes pa nyon mongs pa nang du yang ma bton phyi rol du yang ma yin gnyi ga med par yang ma yin te /
translated: They will not bring the afflictions inside or outside, nor will they do so in a way that is neither of those two.

original: nyon mongs pa khong du chud pa nyid nyon mongs pa med par shes shing nyon mongs pa yang mi sel nyon mongs pa med pa yang mi sgrub nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang sprin dang char sprin 'dra bar shes te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa khong du chud pa nyid nyon mongs pa med par shes shing nyon mongs pa yang mi sel nyon mongs pa med pa yang mi sgrub nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang sprin dang char sprin 'dra bar shes te /
translated: They will understand that the afflictions are not to be eliminated, that the absence of afflictions is not to be accomplished, and that all afflictions are like clouds and rain.

original: ye shes dang lhag mthong gi rlung gis gtor nas phyogs dang yul du 'gro ba yang med gnas pa yang med pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni chu zla dang 'dra ste ;
analyzed: ye shes dang lhag mthong gi rlung gis gtor nas phyogs dang yul du 'gro ba yang med gnas pa yang med pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni chu zla dang 'dra ste ;
translated: They will understand that the afflictions are like the moon in water, and that they are not to be eliminated by the wind of wisdom and insight.

original: yongs su rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bzhin nye bar ston pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams ni mun pa'i spyod yul te /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bzhin nye bar ston pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams ni mun pa'i spyod yul te /
translated: and the afflictions are like darkness,🔽but the lamp of wisdom does not illuminate them.

original: shes rab kyi sgron mas mi snang bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams ni rkun po dang mkha' 'gro ma dang gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgron mas mi snang bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams ni rkun po dang mkha' 'gro ma dang gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The afflictions are like thieves, demons, yakṣas, and rākṣasas,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas brtags na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas brtags na /
translated: but when examined with proper mental attention,🔽they are not present.🔽The afflictions are like those who seek an opportunity,🔽but they increase with improper mental attention.🔽Whoever knows the afflictions to be like this

original: gnas pa ma yin pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni glags tshol ba ste tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas 'phel ba dang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i shes pas yid la 'jug par mi byed par sus nyon mongs pa rnams 'di 'dra bar shes te /
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams ni glags tshol ba ste tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas 'phel ba dang stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i shes pas yid la 'jug par mi byed par sus nyon mongs pa rnams 'di 'dra bar shes te /
translated: and does not engage them with the knowledge of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness

original: sems can nyon mongs @207a * //
analyzed: sems can nyon mongs @207a * //
translated: will not be bound by the afflictions.

original: pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa rnams la snying rje zhing bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa mngon sum du gyur pa ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa yang dag pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pas kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa rnams la snying rje zhing bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa mngon sum du gyur pa ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa yang dag pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, compassion for those who are afflicted and the direct realization of selflessness and the absence of sentient beings is called the “correct disciplinarian.🔽”

original: 'phags pa ma skyes dgra'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma skyes dgra'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the noble Akṣayamatisūtra says,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo khyod la bsgo'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod la bsgo'o //
translated: “Ānanda, I declare this to you,

original: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: you should understand it:

original: gal te mtshams med pa byed pas dam pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas 'jug cing mos na de'i las de las kyi sgrib pa yin no zhes nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te mtshams med pa byed pas dam pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos nas 'jug cing mos na de'i las de las kyi sgrib pa yin no zhes nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: If someone who has committed a heinous crime hears this Dharma discourse, enters into it, and believes in it, I do not say that that action of his is an action-obstacle.🔽”

original: 'di ni chos zab mo la mos pa'i phan yon mdor brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos zab mo la mos pa'i phan yon mdor brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is a brief statement of the benefits of interest in the profound Dharma.

original: rgyas par ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dang de dag las mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde de dang de dag las mnyan par bya'o //
translated: But you should listen to the extensive version in this and that scriptural text of the Universal Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bar chos nyid zab mo la sbyor bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bar chos nyid zab mo la sbyor bar mi bya ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas should not apply themselves to the profound reality without being skilled in means.

original: 'di ltar thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa ni /
translated: Thus, the union of means and wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa'o //
translated: is the correct application of bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad du dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: This is also stated in the Teaching of Vimalakīrti:

original: thabs med pas zin pa'i shes rab bcings pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs med pas zin pa'i shes rab bcings pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the wisdom that is bound because it is not accompanied by means?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la yang nges par rtog cing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la yang nges par rtog cing /
translated: One conceptualizes emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la nges par mi rtog pa 'di ni thabs med pas zin pa'i shes rab ste bcings pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la nges par mi rtog pa 'di ni thabs med pas zin pa'i shes rab ste bcings pa'o //
translated: but does not conceptualize the major and minor marks, the adornment of a buddhafield, and the ripening of sentient beings. This is the wisdom that is bound because it is not accompanied by means.

original: thabs kyis zin pa'i shes rab grol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs kyis zin pa'i shes rab grol ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wisdom that is liberated because it is accompanied by means?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la /
translated: It is to be intent on the marks and signs, on the adornments of a buddhafield, and on bringing beings to maturity.

original: sems nges par rtog cing stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa yang 'dris par byed la /
analyzed: sems nges par rtog cing stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa yang 'dris par byed la /
translated: It is to be familiar with emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and yet not to be discouraged.

original: yongs su mi skyo ba 'di ni thabs kyis zin pa'i shes rab ste grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyo ba 'di ni thabs kyis zin pa'i shes rab ste grol ba'o //
translated: This is the wisdom that is conjoined with means, and it is liberation.

original: shes rab kyis ma zin pa'i thabs bcings pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ma zin pa'i thabs bcings pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the method that is not conjoined with wisdom and is bondage?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lta ba thams cad dang nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba dang bag la nyal ba dang rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la gnas te /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad dang nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba dang bag la nyal ba dang rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la gnas te /
translated: to abide in all views, in the afflictions, in the entanglements, in latent tendencies, in attachment, and in aversion;

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad byang chub tu mi bsngo ba 'di ni shes rab kyis ma zin pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad byang chub tu mi bsngo ba 'di ni shes rab kyis ma zin pa'i thabs te /
translated: and to not dedicate all roots of virtue to awakening. This is the method that is not conjoined with wisdom, and it is bondage.

original: bcings pa'o // shes rab kyis zin pa'i thabs grol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcings pa'o // shes rab kyis zin pa'i thabs grol ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the method that is conjoined with wisdom and is liberation?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lta ba thams cad dang nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba dang bag la nyal dang rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba @207b spangs pas /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad dang nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba dang bag la nyal dang rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba @207b spangs pas /
translated: Since all views, all afflictions, all motivations, all latent impulses, all attachments, and all aversions are abandoned,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngos la des kyang mi snyems pa de ni shes rab kyis zin pa'i thabs te grol ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa thams cad byang chub tu yongs su bsngos la des kyang mi snyems pa de ni shes rab kyis zin pa'i thabs te grol ba'o //
translated: all roots of virtue are dedicated to enlightenment, and one does not become conceited by that. This is the liberation that is the means embraced by wisdom.

original: zhes gsungs so thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pa 'di dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul lo byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pa 'di dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul lo byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul gang zhe na /
translated: All of these that are endowed with means and wisdom are the domain of the bodhisattva. What is the domain of the bodhisattva?

original: de nyid las 'byung ba /🔽gang so so'i skye bo'i spyod yul yang ma yin /
analyzed: de nyid las 'byung ba / gang so so'i skye bo'i spyod yul yang ma yin /
translated: It is said in the same text:🔽The domain of the bodhisattva is not the domain of ordinary beings,

original: 'phags pa'i spyod yul yang ma yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul yang ma yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: and it is not the domain of the āryas.

original: gang 'khor ba yang spyod yul la nyon mongs pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang / gang mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa yang spyod yul la shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang / gang bden pa bzhi'i ye shes kyang spyod yul la dus ma yin par bden pa'i rtog par byed pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba yang spyod yul la nyon mongs pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang / gang mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa yang spyod yul la shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang / gang bden pa bzhi'i ye shes kyang spyod yul la dus ma yin par bden pa'i rtog par byed pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang /
translated: the domain of the wisdom of the four truths but not the domain of those who conceptualize the truths at the wrong time,🔽the domain of those who discern individually but not the domain of those who, while discerning individually, take up existence in accordance with their intentions,

original: gang nang du so sor rtog pa yang spyod yul la bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa yang spyod yul ba dang / gang mi skye bar rab tu rtog pa yang spyod yul la nges par 'gyur ba la 'jug pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: gang nang du so sor rtog pa yang spyod yul la bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa yang spyod yul ba dang / gang mi skye bar rab tu rtog pa yang spyod yul la nges par 'gyur ba la 'jug pa yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang /
translated: the domain of those who realize nonarising but not the domain of those who engage in ascertainment,

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi 'du 'dzi yang spyod yul la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang / gang stong pa nyid kyang spyod yul la rnam pa thams cad du yon tan yongs su tshol ba la yang spyod yul ba dang /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi 'du 'dzi yang spyod yul la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yang spyod yul ma yin pa dang / gang stong pa nyid kyang spyod yul la rnam pa thams cad du yon tan yongs su tshol ba la yang spyod yul ba dang /
translated: It is the domain of those who engage in the activities of all sentient beings while not engaging in the latent tendencies of afflictions.🔽It is the domain of those who seek all the qualities of emptiness while not engaging in the non-formation of anything.

original: gang mngon par 'du mi byed pa yag spyod yul la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa rgyun mi gcod pa yang spyod yul ba dang / gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba yang spyod yul la shin tu zhi bar mi ltung ba yang spyod yul ba dang /
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du mi byed pa yag spyod yul la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa rgyun mi gcod pa yang spyod yul ba dang / gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba yang spyod yul la shin tu zhi bar mi ltung ba yang spyod yul ba dang /
translated: It is the domain of those who do not fall into complete peace while seeking all the phenomena of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: gang chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa yang spyod yul la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mi gtong ba yang spyod yul la 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa yang spyod yul la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mi gtong ba yang spyod yul la 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The domain of the one who turns the wheel of Dharma and the domain of the one who displays great nirvana without abandoning the bodhisattva deeds—this is the domain of the bodhisattva.

original: bdud 'dul ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: bdud 'dul ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Sūtra on Subjugating Demons says:

original: lha'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa yang dag phul ni gang /
analyzed: lha'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba yang dag pa yang dag phul ni gang /
translated: “Divine son, moreover, the bodhisattvas’ application of the highest truth is as follows.

original: shes rab kyi shes pas brtson pa yang med la thabs kyi shes pas dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud pa la yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / @208a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi shes pas brtson pa yang med la thabs kyi shes pas dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud pa la yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / @208a * //
translated: It is to apply the knowledge of wisdom to not striving and to apply the knowledge of method to gathering all virtuous dharmas; it is to apply the knowledge of wisdom to selflessness and to apply the knowledge of method to the welfare of sentient beings; it is to apply the knowledge of wisdom to the absence of sentient beings and to apply the knowledge of method to the welfare of sentient beings; it is to apply the knowledge of wisdom to the absence of life and to apply the knowledge of method to the welfare of sentient beings; it is to apply the knowledge of wisdom to the absence of a person and to apply the knowledge of method to the welfare of sentient beings; it is to apply the knowledge of wisdom to the absence of a self and to apply the knowledge of method to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: srog med pa dang / gso ba po med pa dang / gang zag med par yang sbyor la thabs kyi shes pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa yang sbyor la /
analyzed: srog med pa dang / gso ba po med pa dang / gang zag med par yang sbyor la thabs kyi shes pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa yang sbyor la /
translated: They apply themselves to the absence of life, the absence of a healer, and the absence of a person, and they apply themselves to bringing all sentient beings to full maturity through the knowledge of means.🔽They apply themselves to the non-acceptance and non-rejection of all phenomena through the knowledge of wisdom, and they apply themselves to upholding all phenomena through the knowledge of means.

original: thabs kyi shes pas chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par yang sbyor la thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad la bla mar bya ba dang /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par yang sbyor la thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas thams cad la bla mar bya ba dang /
translated: They apply themselves to the indivisibility of all buddhas and the realm of phenomena through the knowledge of wisdom, and they apply themselves to venerating all buddhas through the knowledge of means.

original: gus par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha'i zhing du yang sbyor la thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyan la yang sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: gus par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nam mkha'i zhing du yang sbyor la thabs kyi shes pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa yongs su sbyong ba'i rgyan la yang sbyor ba dang /
translated: They apply their knowledge of wisdom to the fact that all buddhafields are spacelike buddhafields, and they apply their knowledge of means to the purification of the array of the qualities of the buddhafields.

original: shes rab kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar yang sbyor la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar yang sbyor la /
translated: They apply their knowledge of wisdom to the fact that all noble beings are distinguished by their uncompoundedness,

original: thabs kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad la bla ma dang gus pa dang rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas 'phags pa thams cad la bla ma dang gus pa dang rim gro byed par yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas /
translated: and they apply their knowledge of means to the service, respect, and honor they show to all noble beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku zag pa med par so sor rtog par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku zag pa med par so sor rtog par yang sbyor la /
translated: They apply their knowledge of wisdom to the understanding that the body of the Buddha is uncontaminated,

original: thabs kyi shes pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang rgyan la yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas 'du byed thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma byung bar yang so sor rtog par yang sbyor la /
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang rgyan la yang sbyor ba dang / shes rab kyi shes pas 'du byed thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma byung bar yang so sor rtog par yang sbyor la /
translated: With the knowledge of wisdom, one applies to the individual investigation that all compounded things are unproduced and do not arise.

original: thabs kyi shes pas bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la yang sbyor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thabs kyi shes pas bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la yang sbyor ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: With the knowledge of means, one applies to the taking of birth in existence as one wishes.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las kyang /
translated: The noble Aksayamatinirdesa says,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thabs ni gang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i thabs ni gang /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s means?

original: shes rab mngon par sgrub pa ni gang zhe na ;
analyzed: shes rab mngon par sgrub pa ni gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the accomplishment of wisdom?

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na sems can la lta bas snying rje chen po'i dmigs pa la sems 'dogs pa 'di ni de'i thabs so //
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na sems can la lta bas snying rje chen po'i dmigs pa la sems 'dogs pa 'di ni de'i thabs so //
translated: When one enters meditative equipoise, to focus the mind on the object of great compassion by looking at sentient beings is its means.

original: gang zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba la snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: gang zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba la snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo //
translated: To enter meditative equipoise in peace and complete peace is its wisdom.

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na snying rje chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ston pa 'di ni de'i thabs so ;
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na snying rje chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ston pa 'di ni de'i thabs so ;
translated: The teacher of great compassion and the wisdom of the Buddha to those who enter into meditative absorption: this is their means.

original: / gang ci la yang mi gnas par bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: / gang ci la yang mi gnas par bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo //
translated: The meditative absorption that does not abide in anything at all: this is their wisdom.

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa la lta ba 'di ni de'i thabs so //
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa la lta ba 'di ni de'i thabs so //
translated: The view that all phenomena are completely included in meditative absorption: this is their means.

original: gang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: gang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med par bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo //
translated: The meditative absorption that is the indivisible expanse of reality: this is their wisdom.

original: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na sangs rgyas @208b kyi sku'i rgyan mngon du byed pa 'di ni de'i thabs so //
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa na sangs rgyas @208b kyi sku'i rgyan mngon du byed pa 'di ni de'i thabs so //
translated: The manifestation of the ornaments of the Buddha’s body to those who enter into meditative absorption: this is their means.

original: gang chos kyi sku gnas pas bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang chos kyi sku gnas pas bsam gtan byed pa 'di ni de'i shes rab bo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The meditative absorption that abides in the body of truth: this is their wisdom.

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las kyang /
translated: And the noble Sūtra on the Play of Mañjuśrī also says:

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya ni 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya ni 'di gnyis te /
translated: Maitreya, there are two seals of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di gnyis gang zhe na tshig dang 'bru sna tshogs la dad pa'i phyag rgya dang / chos kyi tshul zab mos mi skrag cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bab pa dang / 'jug pa'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis gang zhe na tshig dang 'bru sna tshogs la dad pa'i phyag rgya dang / chos kyi tshul zab mos mi skrag cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bab pa dang / 'jug pa'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: What are these two? The seal of faith in the various words and letters, and the seal of engagement in the profound way of the Dharma without fear, with correct and precise understanding.

original: phyag rgya de gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya de gnyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: These two seals are the seals of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' gang sems tshig dang 'bru sna tshogs la dad cing lhur byed pa de dag ni las dang po pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' gang sems tshig dang 'bru sna tshogs la dad cing lhur byed pa de dag ni las dang po pa'o //
translated: Among them, those bodhisattvas who are faithful and devoted to the various words and letters are beginners.

original: gang dag mdo sde zab mo ma gos pa phrugs dang snrel zhi'i rgyud kyi tshig dang rim pa rab tu dbye ba 'di 'don pa dang / nyan pa dang mos pa dang ston par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni yun ring po nas tshangs par spyod pa spyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag mdo sde zab mo ma gos pa phrugs dang snrel zhi'i rgyud kyi tshig dang rim pa rab tu dbye ba 'di 'don pa dang / nyan pa dang mos pa dang ston par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni yun ring po nas tshangs par spyod pa spyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those bodhisattvas who recite, listen to, believe in, and teach this profound sutra, the immaculate, complex, and continuous text with its precise divisions, should be known as having practiced pure conduct for a long time.

original: las dang po ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu gnyis kyis bdag la rma 'byin te /
analyzed: las dang po ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu gnyis kyis bdag la rma 'byin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is a beginner wounds himself in two ways.

original: chos zab mo la nges par sems par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos zab mo la nges par sems par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not become certain about the profound teaching.

original: gnyis gang zhe na sngon ma thos pa'i mdo sde zab mo thos na skrag cing the tshom du gyur nas rjes su yi rnag bar mi byed kyi steng du /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na sngon ma thos pa'i mdo sde zab mo thos na skrag cing the tshom du gyur nas rjes su yi rnag bar mi byed kyi steng du /
translated: What are the two? When he hears a profound sutra that he has not heard before, he is frightened and doubtful, and does not accept it, thinking, “Where did this come from? What is it? How could this be the Buddha’s teaching?”

original: 'di lta bu bdag cag gi sngon ma thos na de dag gang nas 'ong zhes spong bar byed pa dang / rigs kyi bu gang dag mdo sde zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pa dang chos zab mo ston pa de dag la mi bsten mi 'grogs bsnyen bkur mi byed cing de dag la bsti stang mi byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu bdag cag gi sngon ma thos na de dag gang nas 'ong zhes spong bar byed pa dang / rigs kyi bu gang dag mdo sde zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pa dang chos zab mo ston pa de dag la mi bsten mi 'grogs bsnyen bkur mi byed cing de dag la bsti stang mi byed par 'gyur te /
translated: He does not rely on or follow the bodhisattvas who are holders of the profound teaching, who are vessels of the profound teaching, and who teach the profound teaching. He does not honor them, does not serve them, and does not respect them.

original: bar bar du de dag la mi snyan pa yang brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bar bar du de dag la mi snyan pa yang brjod pa'o //
translated: He even speaks unpleasantly to them.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis chos zab mo la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid la rma 'byin te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis chos zab mo la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid la rma 'byin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is devoted to the profound teaching wounds himself in two ways.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la yang bzod pa myur du thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la yang bzod pa myur du thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And they will not quickly attain the acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: las dang po pa spyad nas ring por ma lon pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la brnyas shing khyad du gsod de /
analyzed: las dang po pa spyad nas ring por ma lon pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la brnyas shing khyad du gsod de /
translated: They despise and disparage the bodhisattvas who are beginners, who have not been practicing for long.🔽They do not encourage them, do not cause them to take it up, do not make them study it.

original: 'dzin du mi 'jug mi byed mi ston pa dang / gang zab mo la mos pa'i bslab pa la ri mo mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'dzin du mi 'jug mi byed mi ston pa dang / gang zab mo la mos pa'i bslab pa la ri mo mi byed cing /
translated: And they do not respect the training that is devoted to the profound.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing gi sbyin pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs shing chos kyi sbyin pas ma yin te rgyu gnyis po dag go zhes gsungs so //🔽gang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i che ba nyid rgya chen po la 'jug pa'i sems @209a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing gi sbyin pas ni sems can la phan 'dogs shing chos kyi sbyin pas ma yin te rgyu gnyis po dag go zhes gsungs so // gang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i che ba nyid rgya chen po la 'jug pa'i sems @209a * //
translated: They benefit sentient beings through the generosity of worldly goods, but not through the generosity of the Dharma. These are the two causes.

original: can de dag ni shin tu rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: can de dag ni shin tu rnyed par dka'o //
translated: Those sentient beings who are engaged in the vast greatness of the buddhas and bodhisattvas are extremely rare.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i che ba nyid rgya chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i che ba nyid rgya chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the vast greatness of the buddhas and bodhisattvas?

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las 'byung ba /
translated: It is found in the noble Sūtra on the Benevolent and Considerate Advice to a King.

original: btsun pa 'od srungs chen po phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa na byang chub sems dpa' la slong ba gang gis lag pa'am /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srungs chen po phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa na byang chub sems dpa' la slong ba gang gis lag pa'am /
translated: Venerable Mahākāśyapa, in the worlds of the ten directions, innumerable bodhisattvas have given their hands,🔽feet,🔽ears,

original: rkang pa'am / rna ba'am /
analyzed: rkang pa'am / rna ba'am /
translated: noses,🔽blood,

original: sna'am / khrag gam /
analyzed: sna'am / khrag gam /
translated: sinews,🔽bones,

original: rgyus pa'am / rus pa'am /
analyzed: rgyus pa'am / rus pa'am /
translated: marrow,🔽eyes,

original: rkang ngam / mig gam /🔽ro stod dam /
analyzed: rkang ngam / mig gam / ro stod dam /
translated: shoulders,🔽heads,

original: mgo'am / yan lag dang nying lag gam /
analyzed: mgo'am / yan lag dang nying lag gam /
translated: limbs, and minor appendages,

original: rgyal po'i srid dam /
analyzed: rgyal po'i srid dam /
translated: their kingdoms,

original: yul 'khor dang / ljongs sam chung ma dang / bu pho dang / bu mo dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / rta dang ba lang dang / shing rta dang / bzhon pa'am /
analyzed: yul 'khor dang / ljongs sam chung ma dang / bu pho dang / bu mo dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / rta dang ba lang dang / shing rta dang / bzhon pa'am /
translated: their lands, their villages, their wives, their sons and daughters, their male and female servants, their horses and elephants, their chariots and vehicles,

original: gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / man shel dang / bye ru dang / beed'urya dang / nor bu rin po che rnams kyang rung /
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / man shel dang / bye ru dang / beed'urya dang / nor bu rin po che rnams kyang rung /
translated: their gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, quartz, and emeralds,

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bro ba rnams sam /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bro ba rnams sam /
translated: their food and drink, their flavors,

original: gos rnams nyam nga bar byas te /
analyzed: gos rnams nyam nga bar byas te /
translated: and their clothing,

original: slong ba de dag thams cad kyang phal cher bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: slong ba de dag thams cad kyang phal cher bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: And all those beggars were mostly bodhisattvas dwelling in inconceivable liberation,

original: thabs la mkhas pas lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa 'di dag ston to //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa 'di dag ston to //
translated: who were displaying such firm resolve through skillful means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: btsun pa 'od srungs chen po byang /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srungs chen po byang /
translated: Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: chub sems dpa' rnams ni dka' thub drag pas na de lta bur ston te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' rnams ni dka' thub drag pas na de lta bur ston te /
translated: the bodhisattvas demonstrate such things through severe austerities.

original: go skabs ma phye bar byang chub sems dpa' la nyam nga ba byed pa'i mthu skye bo phal po che la med do //🔽go skabs ma phye bar sad pa'am /
analyzed: go skabs ma phye bar byang chub sems dpa' la nyam nga ba byed pa'i mthu skye bo phal po che la med do // go skabs ma phye bar sad pa'am /
translated: Without an opportunity being given, the multitude of people do not have the power to cause the bodhisattvas distress.

original: slong bar yang mi nus so //
analyzed: slong bar yang mi nus so //
translated: Without an opportunity being given, they are not able to awaken or beg.

original: btsun pa 'od srungs chen po 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'od srungs chen po 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Venerable Mahākāśyapa, it is like this:

original: ba lang glang po che'i khur theg pa ni bong bus bzod par mi nus te /
analyzed: ba lang glang po che'i khur theg pa ni bong bus bzod par mi nus te /
translated: For example, a donkey cannot bear the load that an ox or elephant can carry.

original: de bzhin du btsun pa 'od srungs chen po byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' la nyam nga bar byed mi nus kyis byang chub sems dpa' nyid byang chub sems dpa' la nyam nga bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du btsun pa 'od srungs chen po byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' la nyam nga bar byed mi nus kyis byang chub sems dpa' nyid byang chub sems dpa' la nyam nga bar byed de /
translated: Only a bodhisattva can harm a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyam nga bar byas pa byang chub sems dpas bzod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyam nga bar byas pa byang chub sems dpas bzod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: And a bodhisattva forgives a bodhisattva who has harmed him.

original: de skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kyi smon lam gyi gzhi rab tu rtog pa zhes bya ba /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba'i dbyings kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las kyang byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kyi smon lam gyi gzhi rab tu rtog pa zhes bya ba / de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba'i dbyings kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing /
translated: Thus it is said in the noble Array of Stalks Sūtra, in the chapter on the bodhisattva Dharmadhātupraṇidhānanidhyapti.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi zad pa ston pa nas @209b 'ongs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi zad pa ston pa nas @209b 'ongs te /

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i spyan sngar byang chub sems dpa'i mthu rab tu bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i spyan sngar byang chub sems dpa'i mthu rab tu bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: came into the presence of Lord Śākyamuni and displayed the power of a bodhisattva.

translated: from all the major and minor marks, from all the pores of the body, from the whole body, from all the limbs and all the joints, from all the paths of speech, from all the clothes and all the undergarments,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thams cad dang / bdag dang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa thams cad dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lung bstan pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thams cad dang / bdag dang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa thams cad dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lung bstan pa dang /
translated: from the whole retinue of Bodhisattvas, from the Blessed Vairochana, from all the Tathagatas of the past who reached the limit of the past, from all the Tathagatas of the future who will reach the limit of the future,

original: lung ma bstan pa ma byon pa thams cad dang / da ltar byung ba'i phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byam thams cad na bzhugs pa rnams kyi sngon gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho dang /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste dper na /

analyzed: 'di skad du 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag na /

translated: O son of the victors, in this way, the earth element that is taken from the world systems of the four continents is small, while the rest is immeasurable.

translated: O son of the victors, in the same way, even if the bodhisattva ground Cloud of Dharma were taught for countless eons,

original: phyogs tsam zhig bstan du zad na /
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhig bstan du zad na /
translated: it would be merely a partial teaching.

original: de bzhin gsheg pa'i sa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de bzhin gsheg pa'i sa lta smos kyang ci dgos /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras khyod la bsgo'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'di bdag gi mdun na dpang du bzhugs te /

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras gal te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mu med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed cig sa 'di lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bu ram shing gi tshal lam /

translated: O jinaputras! If the buddha realms of the worlds in each of the ten directions, as numerous as the atoms in countless buddha realms, were filled with bodhisattvas who had attained this bhūmi,🔽like sugarcane,🔽bamboos,

original: 'dam bu'i tshal lam 'od ma'i tshal lam /
analyzed: 'dam bu'i tshal lam 'od ma'i tshal lam /

original: til gyi tshal ltar yongs su gang bar gyur kyang de dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par sgrub pa bskal pa mu med par bsgrubs pa dag ni /
analyzed: til gyi tshal ltar yongs su gang bar gyur kyang de dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par sgrub pa bskal pa mu med par bsgrubs pa dag ni /
translated: or like sesame plants, and if they were to practice the bodhisattva conduct for countless eons,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes skad cig yud tsam thang cig tu byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyi brgya'i char yang mi chog pa nas /

original: de bzhin du bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi cha'i bar dang rgyur yang mi chog go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi cha'i bar dang rgyur yang mi chog go zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, up to a hundred thousand times a hundred thousand times ten to the power of the Ganges’ sand grains is not enough for a fraction or part of it.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra Teaching the Inconceivable Qualities and Wisdom of the Tathāgatas says:

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa 'di sems can la la dag gis ni 'khor ba 'di nyid du rab tu 'byung ba la phyogs pa dang / khyim nas mngon par 'byung bar shes so //

original: la la dag gis ni rab tu byung ba dang / la la dag gis ni dka' ba spyod pa la gnas pa dang / la la dag gis ni byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba dang / la la dag gis ni byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa dang /

translated: Some know him to have gone forth, some to be abiding in the practice of austerities, some to be going to the seat of awakening, some to be sitting on the seat of awakening,

original: la la dag gis ni bdud bcom pa dang / la la dag gi ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / la la dag gis ni brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa dang /

translated: some as being requested by Śakra, Brahmā, and the Lokapālas to teach,

original: la la dag gis ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar shes so //
analyzed: la la dag gis ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor bar shes so //
translated: and some as turning the wheel of the Dharma.🔽Some heard the teachings of the Śrāvakayāna,

original: la la dag gis ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam dang / la la dag gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam dang / la la dag gis ni theg pa chen po'i gtam thos so //
analyzed: la la dag gis ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam dang / la la dag gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam dang / la la dag gis ni theg pa chen po'i gtam thos so //
translated: some the teachings of the Pratyekabuddhayāna, and some the teachings of the Mahāyāna.

original: la la dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i srid 'dom gang bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: la la dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i srid 'dom gang bar mthong ngo //
translated: Some saw the Tathāgata’s body as a fathom in size,

original: la la dag gis ni rgyang grags gcig tsam @213a * //
analyzed: la la dag gis ni rgyang grags gcig tsam @213a * //
translated: some as the size of a krosa,🔽and some as the size of a yojana.

original: pa nas / la la dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i srid dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'i bar du mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa nas / la la dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i srid dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'i bar du mthong ngo //
translated: Some see the body of the Tathagata as many hundreds of thousands of millions of yojanas in size.

original: la la dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog lta bu nas /
analyzed: la la dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog lta bu nas /

analyzed: la la dag gis ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i kha dog lta bu'i bar du mthong ngo //

original: la la dag gis ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mdzad pa dang / la la dag gis ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / la la dag gis ni zhugs la bzhen pa dang / la la dag gis ni sku gcig tu sra ba dang /

translated: Some see him as entering Nirvana, some see him as having entered Nirvana, some see him as being entreated to remain, some see his body as solid,

analyzed: la la dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel 'god par shes so //

analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gnas la spyod pa thams cad dang / skyes pa'i rabs thams cad du yang lhun gyis grub pa rnam par mi rtog bzhin du cig car kun snang ngo //
translated: They manifest all the activities in the abodes of the tīrthikas and all the jātakas, spontaneously and nonconceptually, all at once.

analyzed: skad cig gi yun de nyid la phyogs bcu nas skra'i khyon tsam re re dang / spu'i khung bu'i phyogs re re'i bar la dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho dang bcas pa thams cad dang /
translated: In that very instant, from all the directions, from each and every point, from each and every hair-tip, from each and every pore of the skin, all the Tathagatas of the three times, together with the oceans of the retinues of Bodhisattvas,

analyzed: gzhan dag lhun gyis grub pas rnam par mi rtog bzhin du cig car ston te /

translated: But the Tathāgatas do not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub pas rnam par mi rtog bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub pas rnam par mi rtog bzhin du /
translated: However, they are spontaneously present. Without thinking or conceptualizing,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pas mdzad pa 'di lta bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pas mdzad pa 'di lta bu 'byung ngo //
translated: they have the unmixed qualities of a Buddha, and so this kind of activity occurs.

original: zhes rnam pa mang du gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rnam pa mang du gsungs so //
translated: This is stated many times.

original: mdo sde zab mo rgya chen po gang dag las /
analyzed: mdo sde zab mo rgya chen po gang dag las /
translated: In the profound and extensive sutras,🔽the greatness of the buddhas and bodhisattvas is taught.🔽To have interest in them, to write them down, to read them, to make offerings to them, and to respect them, will also greatly increase your merit.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i che ba nyid bstan pa de dag la mos pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / mchod pa dang / bsti stang byed pa yang bsod nams shin tu rgyas par 'phel bar 'gyur te mdo 'di nyid las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i che ba nyid bstan pa de dag la mos pa dang / yi ger 'dri ba dang / klog pa dang / mchod pa dang / bsti stang byed pa yang bsod nams shin tu rgyas par 'phel bar 'gyur te mdo 'di nyid las /
translated: The sutra itself says:

original: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Manjushri, it is like this.

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Mount Meru, the king of mountains,

original: 'phang dang / rngams dang / che ba nyid kyis ri thams cad zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: 'phang dang / rngams dang / che ba nyid kyis ri thams cad zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: towers above all other mountains in height, depth, and greatness.🔽It is radiant,🔽shining,

original: lhag ge / thal le /
analyzed: lhag ge / thal le /
translated: and resplendent.

original: lam me'o // 'jam dpal de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pas kyang /
analyzed: lam me'o // 'jam dpal de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pas kyang /
translated: Manjushri, in the same way, a bodhisattva who has interest in this Dharma discourse

original: 'di lta ste mthong ba dang / yangs pa dang / che ba nyid kyis mdo sde 'di la mos pa /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mthong ba dang / yangs pa dang / che ba nyid kyis mdo sde 'di la mos pa /
translated: towers above all those who have interest in this sutra, in terms of the greatness of his view, vastness, and greatness.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskal pa grangs med par bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul snyed zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskal pa grangs med par bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul snyed zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: The bodhisattva who has accumulated roots of virtue produced by the five perfections over countless eons surpasses in number those who have accumulated roots of virtue produced by the first five perfections.🔽

original: lham me @215a * //
analyzed: lham me @215a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who has accumulated roots of virtue for countless eons through the five perfections surpasses the roots of virtue of all sentient beings in the ten directions, as numerous as the particles of the world systems.🔽He is radiant,

original: dang ; lhan ne dang / lhang nge'o //🔽'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dang ; lhan ne dang / lhang nge'o // 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: luminous, and shining.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun gyi sems can thams cad byang chub kyi sems la rab tu bkod pa bas /🔽'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun gyi sems can thams cad byang chub kyi sems la rab tu bkod pa bas / 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a son or daughter of good family were to establish all sentient beings in the world systems of the ten directions in the mind of awakening,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gzhan zhig phung po med pa'i gnas la mos par gyur na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gzhan zhig phung po med pa'i gnas la mos par gyur na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if another son or daughter of good family were to aspire to the state of non-aggregates,

original: 'di ni de bas bsod nams ches grangs med pa skyed do //
analyzed: 'di ni de bas bsod nams ches grangs med pa skyed do //
translated: this would produce merit immeasurably greater than that.

original: 'jam dpal gal te sems can thams cad phung po med pa'i gnas la mos par gyur pa bas /🔽'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gal te sems can thams cad phung po med pa'i gnas la mos par gyur pa bas / 'jam dpal rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if all sentient beings were to aspire to the state of non-aggregates,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig gis /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig gis /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if another son or daughter of good family🔽were to aspire to the state of non-aggregates,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos nas yi ger 'dri ba'am tha na glegs bam la bris te /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos nas yi ger 'dri ba'am tha na glegs bam la bris te /
translated: If one has faith in this Dharma discourse and writes it down, or even if one just writes it down in a book,

original: mos pas 'chang ngam /
analyzed: mos pas 'chang ngam /
translated: and then faithfully keeps it,

original: mar me dang / bdug pa dang / me tog dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pas mchod na 'di ni de bas bsod nams ches grangs med pa skyed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mar me dang / bdug pa dang / me tog dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pas mchod na 'di ni de bas bsod nams ches grangs med pa skyed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: and worships it with lamps, incense, flowers, perfumes, garlands, and ointments, then this produces merit that is incalculably greater than that.

original: mdo sde sna tshogs las btus pa /
analyzed: mdo sde sna tshogs las btus pa /
translated: The Compendium of Various Sutras

original: theg pa chen po rin po che'i gtam /
analyzed: theg pa chen po rin po che'i gtam /
translated: The Discourse on the Precious Great Vehicle🔽Composed by Ācārya Ārya Nāgārjuna

original: a'a ts'arya a'ar+ya n'a g'ardzu nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: a'a ts'arya a'ar+ya n'a g'ardzu nas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: is completed.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
